This is required to apply changes that could be made to the networking
configuration of environment.
The major case is: add/remove node network group(s).

The configuration changes are not tracked as nailgun does not have
proper functionality for that.

New key is introduced in task description: reexecute_on (list).

commit_message:
Rerun network setup on deployed nodes

This is required to apply changes that could be made to the networking
configuration of environment.
The major case is: add/remove node network group(s).

The configuration changes are not tracked as nailgun does not have
proper functionality for that.

New key is introduced in task description: reexecute_on (list).
Deployment tasks which are to be re-executed on deploy changes must have

reexecute_on:
  - deploy_changes

DocImpact

Change-Id: I668fcb426826cecf69a5c7fc1e92b8ae8dfeef9f
Blueprint: redeploy-network-on-changes

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-02 11:30:42.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt'], 'message': "Limit version of keystonemiddleware to before 4

Major version 4 fixed the way options were handled, but broke our code.
We could probably fix into Gnocchi, but it's simpler to just limit
people to an old Keystonemiddleware. Future version of Gnocchi won't
depend on it anyway.

Change-Id: Ie657c9dd874bed61118fec1b28abd4a6fa05c010
"}]
commit_message:
Limit version of keystonemiddleware to before 4

Major version 4 fixed the way options were handled, but broke our code.
We could probably fix into Gnocchi, but it's simpler to just limit
people to an old Keystonemiddleware. Future version of Gnocchi won't
depend on it anyway.

Change-Id: Ie657c9dd874bed61118fec1b28abd4a6fa05c010

It can be quite useful to replace the running of work

Change-Id: I8f4a806ed698370b4f5a300d74ee507cbe4eebc5
'}]
commit_message:
Allow for providing different run work sync functions

It can be quite useful to replace the running of work
function in the sync executor with a function that logs
or with a function that shows whats running, or other
so enable that replacement by having a new sync executor
parameter that can be provided to give alternate functions
that run work items.

Change-Id: I8f4a806ed698370b4f5a300d74ee507cbe4eebc5

subject: Ability to define the mtu globally (for all the container networks)
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-12-02 01:09:33.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/roles/lxc_container_create/defaults/main.yml', 'playbooks/roles/lxc_container_create/templates/container-interface.ini.j2'], 'message': 'Ability to define the mtu globally (for all the container networks)

Currently, deployers can override MTUs on a per-network basis,
but may be looking for a way to define the mtu globally.

This implements a variable named ``lxc_container_default_mtu``
that currently defaults to 1500 (standard value). If this variable
is set, it will globally override the mtu, while still keeping the
per-network override.

Closes-Bug: #1518311

Change-Id: Ic8b9884acc45cb62d9ab25ae0267cf4c026ece33
'}]
commit_message:
Ability to define the mtu globally (for all the container networks)

Currently, deployers can override MTUs on a per-network basis,
but may be looking for a way to define the mtu globally.

This implements a variable named ``lxc_container_default_mtu``
that currently defaults to 1500 (standard value). If this variable
is set, it will globally override the mtu, while still keeping the
per-network override.

Closes-Bug: #1518311

Change-Id: Ic8b9884acc45cb62d9ab25ae0267cf4c026ece33

subject: Add identity v3 API filtering to users and projects tables
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 5623, 'name': 'David Lyle', 'email': 'dklyle0@gmail.com', 'username': 'david-lyle'}, {'_account_id': 8040, 'name': 'Timur Sufiev', 'email': 'tsufiev@gmail.com', 'username': 'tsufiev'}, {'_account_id': 9647, 'name': 'Justin Pomeroy', 'email': 'jpomero@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'jpomero'}, {'_account_id': 9981, 'name': 'Doug Fish', 'email': 'drfish@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'doug-fish'}, {'_account_id': 11902, 'name': 'Randy Bertram', 'email': 'rbertram@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'rbertram'}, {'_account_id': 13325, 'name': 'Paul Karikh', 'email': 'pkarikh@gmail.com', 'username': 'paul.karikh'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 15, 'created': '2014-11-07 15:03:08.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/dashboards/identity/users/views.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/identity/projects/tests.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/identity/users/tables.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/identity/projects/tables.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/identity/projects/views.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/admin/images/views.py', 'openstack_dashboard/local/local_settings.py.example', 'openstack_dashboard/api/keystone.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/identity/users/tests.py', 'doc/source/topics/settings.rst', 'horizon/tables/views.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/admin/instances/views.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/instances/views.py', 'horizon/templates/horizon/common/_data_table_table_actions.html'], 'message': 'Add identity v3 API filtering to users and projects tables

This adds API filtering to the Users and Projects tables when
using the identity v3 API. The new table_row_limit setting from
HORIZON_CONFIG is used as the maximum number of rows to display
in the table. If more than the max number are returned then the
data is truncated and a warning message is displayed telling the
user to use a filter to narrow down the results.

Experiments have shown that the Users page takes about 20 seconds
to load when there are 1049 users. Certainly this number will
depend on many variables, but of that 20 seconds only 0.37 seconds
is spent making the request to obtain the data. The 0.37 seconds
was obtained by using curl to make the request to list the users.
So the vast majority of the time seems to be spent rendering the
page. The default row rendering limit of 500 was chosen based on
these results with the assumptions that loading the page with 500
users would take roughly 10 seconds and that showing any more than
500 of anything on a page is not very useful. These assumptions are
of course open to debate.

It seems at the moment that user email and project description
fields are not filterable in identity v3, so the only field
that can currently be filtered on these tables is the name.

This patch also includes some general improvements to the API
filtering support in horizon and fixes an issue that will occur
if API filtering is used on a table with inline editing.

Closes-Bug: #1321483
Change-Id: I7f2a0567d685decde84f34b345fa1827bd3d8ac5
'}]
commit_message:
Add identity v3 API filtering to users and projects tables

This adds API filtering to the Users and Projects tables when
using the identity v3 API. The new table_row_limit setting from
HORIZON_CONFIG is used as the maximum number of rows to display
in the table. If more than the max number are returned then the
data is truncated and a warning message is displayed telling the
user to use a filter to narrow down the results.

Experiments have shown that the Users page takes about 20 seconds
to load when there are 1049 users. Certainly this number will
depend on many variables, but of that 20 seconds only 0.37 seconds
is spent making the request to obtain the data. The 0.37 seconds
was obtained by using curl to make the request to list the users.
So the vast majority of the time seems to be spent rendering the
page. The default row rendering limit of 500 was chosen based on
these results with the assumptions that loading the page with 500
users would take roughly 10 seconds and that showing any more than
500 of anything on a page is not very useful. These assumptions are
of course open to debate.

It seems at the moment that user email and project description
fields are not filterable in identity v3, so the only field
that can currently be filtered on these tables is the name.

This patch also includes some general improvements to the API
filtering support in horizon and fixes an issue that will occur
if API filtering is used on a table with inline editing.

Closes-Bug: #1321483
Change-Id: I7f2a0567d685decde84f34b345fa1827bd3d8ac5

revisions:

The lxc_host role overrides the configuration

commit_message:
Added to ability to set mtu for lxcbr0

The lxc_host role overrides the configuration
done by the system administrator on the host.

If mtu was defined in /etc/lxc/ and in the
system network interfaces, then these configurations
will be overriden.

This commit should allow the deployer to set the
mtu for its lxcbr0 network, by setting the variable
lxc_net_mtu.

Change-Id: I42ab3d0a2c20ae94335de195cdb14579d9f59f5f
Fixes-Bug: #1518303

commit_message:
increase cryptography from 1.0.1 to 1.1

cryptography <1.0.2 has an issue where asserts can be optimized away.
This could cause an issue where invalid response codes could result
in undefined behavior or worse.

Change-Id: Id626db6b21bf5dc7e686875d47f45a61feb96e1e

commit_message:
Fix broken ENABLED_SERVICES in neutron and scalpels jobs

- Fix missing comma between n-sch and q-svc
- Use OVERRIDE_ENABLED_SERVICES instead, as it seems like the
  intention of the original change [1]

Note that this effectively remove the following from ENABLED_SERVICES:

    c-api
    c-bak
    c-sch
    c-vol
    ceilometer-acentral
    ceilometer-acompute
    ceilometer-alarm-evaluator
    ceilometer-alarm-notifier
    ceilometer-anotification
    ceilometer-api
    ceilometer-collector
    cinder
    dstat
    horizon
    q-fwaas
    q-lbaas
    q-metering
    quantum
    s-account
    s-container
    s-object
    s-proxy

[1] Iccba951301d2c09e01b6c1a15ed1e88c8e0db69e

Change-Id: I29e3e098bd972b88551db70e280aa86facbd8f42

commit_message:
influxdb.conf location different for 0.9.5

Also, it is installed in /usr/bin so there is no /opt/influxdb. So, put
influxdb setup script in /opt/monasca

Also, data directory is different for 0.9.5. Use /var/lib/influxdb instead
of /var/opt/influxdb

Change-Id: Id60be4842d5f62481af5dfbb930c226666a8678b

subject: bagpipe: port delete action on BEFORE_DELETE event
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-12-02 15:00:07.000000000', 'files': ['networking_bgpvpn/neutron/db/bgpvpn_db.py', 'networking_bgpvpn/tests/unit/services/test_plugin.py'], 'message': "bagpipe: port delete action on BEFORE_DELETE event

Details on the issue in bug #1517480.

We need to subscribe to port before_delete events, because
on after_delete events the port is already removed from the db
and we can't retrieve the binding:host_id information (which
is not passed in the event either).

This change also include a unit test against this bug, which also
happens to go through the ML2 RPC-to-registry codepaths so that
the effect of real registry events against our code are tested, thus
testing the validity of the expectation that the bagpipe driver code
has against ML2. This addresses bug #1493901.

One test is not passing, and thus commented out: see bug 1519258.

Change-Id: Icce89d98bcc4424529dcbe661fed3c1c8191418c
"}]
commit_message:
bagpipe: port delete action on BEFORE_DELETE event

Details on the issue in bug #1517480.

We need to subscribe to port before_delete events, because
on after_delete events the port is already removed from the db
and we can't retrieve the binding:host_id information (which
is not passed in the event either).

This change also include a unit test against this bug, which also
happens to go through the ML2 RPC-to-registry codepaths so that
the effect of real registry events against our code are tested, thus
testing the validity of the expectation that the bagpipe driver code
has against ML2. This addresses bug #1493901.

One test is not passing, and thus commented out: see bug 1519258.

Change-Id: Icce89d98bcc4424529dcbe661fed3c1c8191418c

commit_message:
Setup cluster setting by chosen components

Modifying cluster creation API (POST /api/clusters) for handling
components data and setup proper values of cluster attributes by
components from wizard. Change storage components metadata.

commit_message:
API for master node level dashboard links

This patch inroduces set of API handlers for links to
the plugin dashboards that running on the master node:

plugins/:plugin_id/links/
plugins/:plugin_id/links/:link_id

Implements blueprint external-dashboard-links-support-in-nailgun
Closes-Bug: #1520287

Change-Id: Ia0e4e096ff5df595c6797ac76b1845ccdbb6cd3c

subject: [Rally] temporary turn off requirements job
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-12-02 11:55:51.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': "[Rally] temporary turn off requirements job

Rally team wants to cut last release with py26 support, but we can't do
it due to dropped support of py26 in several openstack libraries.

Our plan:
 - turn off requirements-check
 - fix local(rally) requirements
 - cut new release
 - turn on requirements-check

Change-Id: I0c5e4d5ee9455641e3db55e5e2b43618683d93e5
"}]
commit_message:
[Rally] temporary turn off requirements job

Rally team wants to cut last release with py26 support, but we can't do
it due to dropped support of py26 in several openstack libraries.

Our plan:
 - turn off requirements-check
 - fix local(rally) requirements
 - cut new release
 - turn on requirements-check

Change-Id: I0c5e4d5ee9455641e3db55e5e2b43618683d93e5

revisions:

That version uses the key/value store exposed by the OpenContrail
API but that's not efficient. The BGP/VPN resources and sub-association
need to be added to the OpenContrail data model.

That first PoC will be delivered to with the Liberty release but will be
replaced by a final one for Mitaka and next releases without any
migration script or method from the first PoC version.

Implements: blueprint opencontrail-bgpvpn-driver
Change-Id: I3795dd7b24afdac1cd5134c41b6b32ef8a888287
"}]
commit_message:
Add OpenContrail driver

That version uses the key/value store exposed by the OpenContrail
API but that's not efficient. The BGP/VPN resources and sub-association
need to be added to the OpenContrail data model.

That first PoC will be delivered to with the Liberty release but will be
replaced by a final one for Mitaka and next releases without any
migration script or method from the first PoC version.

Implements: blueprint opencontrail-bgpvpn-driver
Change-Id: I3795dd7b24afdac1cd5134c41b6b32ef8a888287

commit_message:
[Ironic] Configure neutron-server only on controllers

Since new role Ironic added and requires OVS agent, condition of
neutron-server installations should be changed.
In case if ironic node is not combined with controller, it has no
neutron-server.

Implements: blueprint fuel-integrate-ironic

Change-Id: I31624c9bbe7857f7a78e8a7911766668af2aa74b

commit_message:
[WIP] Enable TLS reception for rsyslog server

This patch enables TLS log reception for the rsyslog server installed by
openstack-ansible. This also opens the door for various rsyslog clients
to use encrypted connections to transmit logs.

Closes-bug: 1510154

Change-Id: I7297dcb52b09cf22d27150a14a4cd4912cd39f3e

subject: Remove py26 support
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-02 07:58:33.000000000', 'files': ['setup.cfg', 'tox.ini'], 'message': "Remove py26 support

as of mitaka, the infra team won't have the resources available to
reasonably test py26, also the oslo team is dropping py26 support
from their libraries. sine we rely on oslo for a lot of our work,
and depend on infra for our CI, we should drop py26 support too.

Change-Id: I8c1e5765228382c9982883320568fe729d0c35f8
Closes-Bug: 1519510
"}]
commit_message:
Remove py26 support

as of mitaka, the infra team won't have the resources available to
reasonably test py26, also the oslo team is dropping py26 support
from their libraries. sine we rely on oslo for a lot of our work,
and depend on infra for our CI, we should drop py26 support too.

Change-Id: I8c1e5765228382c9982883320568fe729d0c35f8
Closes-Bug: 1519510

This change reads the auth_version from the configs. This means that

Closes-bug: 1507991

commit_message:
Make auth_version not hardcoded

This change reads the auth_version from the configs. This means that
the keystone version is not hardcoded and will update as users change
the keystone version used in the configs eg. keystone v2 to keystone
v3. This causes this code to become more future proof, for version
changes in keystone.

Change-Id: I33e757becf9cccd9b6ee607068c2326e4afe472c
Closes-bug: 1507991

commit_message:
Make enabling of controller services configurable.

Following parameters will be user configurable:
1. enable_dhcp_agent
2. enable_metadta_agent
3. enable_l3_agent
4. enable_ovs_agent

This change was made as the Nuage plugin does not require these
services to come up as a part of the installation.
Now, a user can explicitly disable these services using a heat
template.

Change-Id: Ic132ecbb2e81a3746f304da1cecdc66d0342db72

commit_message:
do not commit requirements syncs

We need to test without committing the requirements changes because pbr
throws an error if the pre and post versioning do not match. The first
change on a stable branch must be the one to remove the pre-versioning
configuration.

Change-Id: I812af614b7a6c7f499c67310f078ac4835b9e91a
(cherry picked from commit cd88f6c3f639dea3370c6c4b4178e77b14a3b4e2)

commit_message:
do not commit requirements syncs

We need to test without committing the requirements changes because pbr
throws an error if the pre and post versioning do not match. The first
change on a stable branch must be the one to remove the pre-versioning
configuration.

Change-Id: I812af614b7a6c7f499c67310f078ac4835b9e91a
(cherry picked from commit cd88f6c3f639dea3370c6c4b4178e77b14a3b4e2)

commit_message:
Fix pylint breakage for kilo

Using test-requirements.txt to pin pylint to 1.4.4 and astroid (a
dependency) to less than 1.4.0, as newer versions break pylint.

It is expected that pylint will not be updated on this branch.

Change-Id: I276126b9ed3c1aec70e32cd582bb0f891d90e007

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1955, 'name': 'Alan Pevec', 'email': 'alan.pevec@redhat.com', 'username': 'apevec'}, {'_account_id': 6659, 'name': 'Paul Michali', 'email': 'pc@michali.net', 'username': 'pcm'}, {'_account_id': 9656, 'name': 'Ihar Hrachyshka', 'email': 'ihrachys@redhat.com', 'username': 'ihrachys', 'status': 'Red Hat Networking Systems Engineer'}, {'_account_id': 12898, 'name': 'Tony Breeds', 'email': 'tony@bakeyournoodle.com', 'username': 'tonyb'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-01 18:27:20.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'message': "Cap astroid to unbreak pylint.

While projects run different versions of pylint, astroid which is a pylint
dependency has done an API breaking point release - 1.4.{0,1} breaks pylint
1.4.4.

Since this is a stable branch, I'm just capping everything, we have no
expectation of projects in stable branches revising their pylint versions.

Upstream bug url: https://bitbucket.org/logilab/astroid/issues/275/140-and-141-fail-to-work-with-pylint-144

nb: the upstream response is that astroid 1.4 is deliberately breaking
and should have been 2.0.

Change-Id: Iaf2c5dbb92cacbc236083f8f6926a426bfb28f21
"}]
commit_message:
Cap astroid to unbreak pylint.

While projects run different versions of pylint, astroid which is a pylint
dependency has done an API breaking point release - 1.4.{0,1} breaks pylint
1.4.4.

Since this is a stable branch, I'm just capping everything, we have no
expectation of projects in stable branches revising their pylint versions.

Upstream bug url: https://bitbucket.org/logilab/astroid/issues/275/140-and-141-fail-to-work-with-pylint-144

nb: the upstream response is that astroid 1.4 is deliberately breaking
and should have been 2.0.

Sometimes we need to re-execute some tasks on all nodes, including

will be re-executed by nailgun on 'ready' nodes and thus update

Change-Id: I4e9c4c3ae4f4f9552e068bc4cd1a117b3da87ab6

commit_message:
Add reexecute_on parameter to needed tasks

Sometimes we need to re-execute some tasks on all nodes, including
already deployed ondes, on deploy changes. The major use case is
adding/removing node network group(s) when we need to reconfigure
routing on all nodes.

So tasks that have 'deploy_changes' in their 'reexecute_on' list
will be re-executed by nailgun on 'ready' nodes and thus update
network/firewall setup on them.

Case with adding controllers is handled separately and we run all
deployment tasks in such case.

It's related to change-id: I668fcb426826cecf69a5c7fc1e92b8ae8dfeef9f
Blueprint: redeploy-network-on-changes

Change-Id: I4e9c4c3ae4f4f9552e068bc4cd1a117b3da87ab6

commit_message:
Virtual guest device role tagging

This will provide a mechanism for the user to tag a device they
have assigned to their guest with a specific role. The tag will
be matched to the hardware address of the device and this mapping
exposed to the guest OS via metadata service/cloud-init

APIImpact
Change-Id: I16845bd36878bbd9d7a877dc556b2650bc6f0fad

Now a NodeInfo object has a lock instance attached, which is associated
with a node UUID. New calls acquire_lock and release_lock are added.

NodeInfo.finished now always release a lock.

commit_message:
Lock nodes to avoid simultaneous introspection requests

Now a NodeInfo object has a lock instance attached, which is associated
with a node UUID. New calls acquire_lock and release_lock are added.
NodeInfo.find_node now always acquire a lock, get_node does it optionally.
NodeInfo.finished now always release a lock.

Note that this change does not make NodeInfo thread-safe. Rather it's
preventing simultaneous operations on the same node.

Change-Id: I0c0bd2f4e0622fd7086660b0874c5b8dca82b4d2
Implements: blueprint node-state

Cover reinstall procedure for Reduced Footprint feaure:

1) fuel node --node 1 --disk --download
2) edit disk.yaml (set keep_data to true)
3) fuel node --node 1 --disk --upload
4) provision virt node
5) spawn vms (fuel2 env spawn-vms <env-id>)
6) wait for VMs to comes up
7) deploy virt node

Change-Id: I0c00000453d16d14c28d10f87d066d9890181db0
Closes-Bug: #1505147
'}]
commit_message:
Partition preservation scope for RF

Cover reinstall procedure for Reduced Footprint feaure:

1) fuel node --node 1 --disk --download
2) edit disk.yaml (set keep_data to true)
3) fuel node --node 1 --disk --upload
4) provision virt node
5) spawn vms (fuel2 env spawn-vms <env-id>)
6) wait for VMs to comes up
7) deploy virt node

Change-Id: I0c00000453d16d14c28d10f87d066d9890181db0
Closes-Bug: #1505147

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-27 06:56:30.000000000', 'files': ['designate/central/service.py', 'designate/context.py', 'designate/backend/impl_dynect.py', 'designate/manage/tlds.py', 'designate/manage/akamai.py', 'designate/backend/agent.py', 'designate/backend/impl_infoblox/__init__.py', 'designate/backend/impl_fake.py', 'designate/central/rpcapi.py', 'designate/mdns/handler.py', 'designate/utils.py', 'designate/mdns/notify.py', 'designate/mdns/rpcapi.py'], 'message': "Improving info level log messages

String interpolation should be delayed to be handled by the
logging code, rather than being done at the point of the
logging call.

So we should use-

LOG.info(_LI('some message: variable=%s'), variable)

instead of

LOG.info(_LI('some message: variable=%s') % variable)

Change-Id: I6b3e578f2a0b66f253d49fe44766b6a31196a7c4
link: http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.i18n/guidelines.html
"}]
commit_message:
Improving info level log messages

String interpolation should be delayed to be handled by the
logging code, rather than being done at the point of the
logging call.

So we should use-

LOG.info(_LI('some message: variable=%s'), variable)

instead of

LOG.info(_LI('some message: variable=%s') % variable)

Change-Id: I6b3e578f2a0b66f253d49fe44766b6a31196a7c4
link: http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.i18n/guidelines.html

commit_message:
Check resource_id before calling network delete

On Rackspace::Cloud::Network delete, current code does not
check if resource_id (network_id) is valid or not. So adding
a check before calling network delete.

commit_message:
Remove py26 support

as of mitaka, the infra team won't have the resources available to
reasonably test py26, also the oslo team is dropping py26 support
from their libraries. sine we rely on oslo for a lot of our work,
and depend on infra for our CI, we should drop py26 support too.

Change-Id: I31bb7a18a1793b2664cc924777801e16e4105192
Closes-Bug: 1519510

commit_message:
Add selective SSL support

Add second-level hash for TLS support. If user mixing this hash into his
astute.yaml, values from it will be taken to TLS-related tasks instead
of ones from UI.

Hash to use looks like:

use_ssl:
  horizon: true
  horizon_public: true
  horizon_public_hostname: horizon.fuel.local
  horizon_public_usercert: true
  horizon_public_certdata: KeyPairStoredHere

  keystone: true
  keystone_public: true
  keystone_public_ip: <ip of external keystone>
  ...
  keystone_internal: true
  ...
  keystone_admin: true
  ...

  glance: true
  glance_public: true
  ...

Co-Authored-By: Stanislaw Bogatkin <sbogatkin@mirantis.com>
Related to blueprint selective-ssl
Change-Id: Ic3034b3fea27a370b1f7cbd4e088f361fce96142

commit_message:
bagpipe: work on notification without port info

This change updates the bagpipe driver so that
information is always retrieved from the db, which fixes the
cases where the port info is absent from the notification.

Closes-Bug: 1520629
Change-Id: I41a4e77b33d0b8790302b58ae625b41d28b2df9a

commit_message:
[Ironic] Add network roles for ironic

This change introduces:
* NovaNetworkManager80
* ironic/api network role
* ironic/baremetal network role with VIP and iptables rules

Added separate fixture for network template.
Tests updated.

Partially Implements: blueprint fuel-integrate-ironic

Change-Id: Ib867f843951f7b86be31a9ffe4cf54c56127157b

subject: Hack python 2.6 test with python 2.7
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-12-02 12:50:55.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': "Hack python 2.6 test with python 2.7

because following commit
https://github.com/openstack/python-keystoneclient/commit/
f4e6f12a714080a1e0391d4891d3bcf0eecfbaaf
python novaclient's dependency patch of keystoneclient don't
support py26 now, and
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/252256/ proposed
to remove py26 support, in order to make python-novaclient
workable before that patch landed, this is a workaround
temply.

Co-Authored-By: Andrey Kurilin <akurilin@mirantis.com>

Change-Id: I6254ce08377fd117d2fc6ee5c5df8279030db3df
"}]
commit_message:
Hack python 2.6 test with python 2.7

because following commit
https://github.com/openstack/python-keystoneclient/commit/
f4e6f12a714080a1e0391d4891d3bcf0eecfbaaf
python novaclient's dependency patch of keystoneclient don't
support py26 now, and
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/252256/ proposed
to remove py26 support, in order to make python-novaclient
workable before that patch landed, this is a workaround
temply.

Co-Authored-By: Andrey Kurilin <akurilin@mirantis.com>

Change-Id: I6254ce08377fd117d2fc6ee5c5df8279030db3df

subject: Add check for OVS to be up before starting L3 agent
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-12-02 02:42:20.000000000', 'files': ['labs/osbash/scripts/ubuntu/setup_neutron_network.sh'], 'message': 'Add check for OVS to be up before starting L3 agent

Neutron L3 agent can only be started when OVS is fully up.
So far this was handled by a simple sleep (1 sec), but it
can take considerably longer than that.
This patch adds a check for OVS to be up.

Change-Id: Ib5019148c8d0a7ecc55557426f067c1f76354c02
'}]
commit_message:
Add check for OVS to be up before starting L3 agent

Neutron L3 agent can only be started when OVS is fully up.
So far this was handled by a simple sleep (1 sec), but it
can take considerably longer than that.
This patch adds a check for OVS to be up.

Change-Id: Ib5019148c8d0a7ecc55557426f067c1f76354c02

commit_message:
Support triggering crash dump in a server.

This spec adds a new API to trigger crash dump in a server (instance or baremetal),
by injecting an NMI(Non-maskable Interruption) to the server.

Implements: blueprint instance-crash-dump
Change-Id: Ie555c0da54204d19500a9cae0e6607326fe04a9f
Co-Authored-By: Hironori Shiina <shiina.hironori@jp.fujitsu.com>
Co-Authored-By: Tang Chen <tangchen@cn.fujitsu.com>

subject: trap errors from git not being present
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-01 16:38:56.000000000', 'files': ['oslosphinx/__init__.py'], 'message': "trap errors from git not being present

subprocess raises OSError if the command it is asked to run isn't found,
so trap that as well as the subprocess-specific error we were already
catching.

Change-Id: Ieb9c7f3ccc307250847104a7f97cfa28603fcf5d
Closes-Bug: #1521541
"}]
commit_message:
trap errors from git not being present

subprocess raises OSError if the command it is asked to run isn't found,
so trap that as well as the subprocess-specific error we were already
catching.

Change-Id: Ieb9c7f3ccc307250847104a7f97cfa28603fcf5d
Closes-Bug: #1521541

commit_message:
Use new docker package name

In CentOS7 docker package name is 'docker', instead of
'docker-io' in CentOS6

Blueprint: master-on-centos7

Is compatible with CentOS6 master node

Change-Id: Ib81c7f90b51aa4721f292988a9642dad3974f29b

commit_message:
[DONOTMERGE]
[Ironic] Add callback script for deploy with Ironic

A new executable 'ironic_callback' added. This script does
call back to Ironic API with IP address of boot interface.

Implements blueprint: baremetal-deploy-ironic
Change-Id: I10fadd34f3c0c0979a5fcb9bcb487ef99e720523

Add symbol equal "=" in several filter texts

(like in the majority).

  - Admin --> System --> Instance ("Name")

revisions:

Implement re-authentication mechanism for swift driver in case
when user token will expire.
For single tenant glance_store uses swift user parameters to

For multi tenant glance_store uses trust mechanism.

Change-Id: Id4d59b25bceab5be4cc3464d47076fcc1c97a2bf
'}]
commit_message:
Implement re-auth for swift driver

Implement re-authentication mechanism for swift driver in case
when user token will expire.
For single tenant glance_store uses swift user parameters to
receive the new token.
For multi tenant glance_store uses trust mechanism.

Change-Id: Id4d59b25bceab5be4cc3464d47076fcc1c97a2bf

commit_message:
Adds Neutron Agent initialisation and executable

Previously, the Hyper-V Neutron Agent was partially decomposed
from the Neutron project, mainly the executable and RPC
initialisation remained in the project. This commit will add those
parts to the networking_hyperv project, in order to fully decompose
the code from Neutron.

Adds neutron_hyperv_agent as an entry_point.
Adds eventlet monkey patching.
Adds HyperVNeutronAgent and HyperVSecurityAgent RPC initialisation.
Refactors the configuration options into a separate module.
Adds parent class and constructor to HypervMechanismDriver.
Adds tools/tox_install.sh.

Closes-Bug: #1520054
Change-Id: I3a25f18b4f3a0621cb92b44eb61e434fa87e0aab

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-15 18:02:56.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/api/contrib/quotas.py', 'requirements.txt'], 'message': "WIP: Fix Keystone's auth_url in quotas.py

In quotas.py CONF.keymgr.encryption_auth_url was used to determine
Keystone's auth_url. This is wrong, because this particular option
should be related to keymgr used for encryption and doesn't need to be
configured if we're not providing a keymgr backend. As it defaults to
localhost it started to cause problems when Keystone API was deployed
somewhere else than c-api. Moreover it was fixed to force Keystone's V3
API.

This commit switches to use CONF.keystone_authtoken.auth_uri and proper
version discovery instead.

Change-Id: I7a576674a3734e12cd876b84b5adca8e3c7e2655
Closes-Bug: 1516085
"}]
commit_message:
WIP: Fix Keystone's auth_url in quotas.py

In quotas.py CONF.keymgr.encryption_auth_url was used to determine
Keystone's auth_url. This is wrong, because this particular option
should be related to keymgr used for encryption and doesn't need to be
configured if we're not providing a keymgr backend. As it defaults to
localhost it started to cause problems when Keystone API was deployed
somewhere else than c-api. Moreover it was fixed to force Keystone's V3
API.

This commit switches to use CONF.keystone_authtoken.auth_uri and proper
version discovery instead.

Change-Id: I7a576674a3734e12cd876b84b5adca8e3c7e2655
Closes-Bug: 1516085

subject: Improve message for publish package conflict
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-10-16 03:40:23.000000000', 'files': ['murano/db/catalog/api.py'], 'message': 'Improve message for publish package conflict

Previously, end user will receive a conflict message "Class with the same full
name is already registered in the visibility scope" when publish package
conflict with one public package with same fqn. The "class" concept might be
not familiar to end user who doesn't know murano package details.

And in most cases, user will modify the class name in package. So it would be
better to check the duplicate fqn at first, which it give back a more straight
message "Package with the same Name is already made public" in this case.

Change-Id: I721ce60cb213fc446f62755b3b59523aca5d5fcb
Closes-Bug: #1506703
'}]
commit_message:
Improve message for publish package conflict

Previously, end user will receive a conflict message "Class with the same full
name is already registered in the visibility scope" when publish package
conflict with one public package with same fqn. The "class" concept might be
not familiar to end user who doesn't know murano package details.

And in most cases, user will modify the class name in package. So it would be
better to check the duplicate fqn at first, which it give back a more straight
message "Package with the same Name is already made public" in this case.

Change-Id: I721ce60cb213fc446f62755b3b59523aca5d5fcb
Closes-Bug: #1506703

commit_message:
[Ironic] Configure Swift as Glance backend when Ironic enabled

Glance should use Swift backend to get images available to use in Ironic
If images_ceph is selected, Glance should use Swift API via RadosGW

Ironic also should be configured to use RadosGW endpoint.

Implements: blueprint fuel-integrate-ironic (partially)

Change-Id: Ia71e69f7171d245c12ccbd862fafdc0e7c216d67

and mock envs

commit_message:
[config-ref] Update manila Huawei driver

Consolidate driver documentation:
* Follow documentation conventions
* Fix grammar and wording
* Use proper formatting
* Remove duplicated content

Remove also stated support for "create snapshot from share" as that one
is not part of the support (see share types note).

Remove share type section, this is completely confusing and needs first
a proper documentation of filters in general documentation.

commit_message:
Reauthenticate on token expiration

Add new config option reauthentication_auth_plugin
for enforce usage of trusts_auth_plugin for making
authenticated requests.
Also add stale_token_duration option for determing
time in seconds before token expiration for considering
such token as about to expire.
Try to get new token if old token is about to expire.
Add reauthentication for stack create/update actions.

Change-Id: Id7d6692128964f4ef35762d43ef2738df0d83f4b
Co-Authored-By: Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1306294

subject: Make Server software_config_transport updatable
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-11-30 21:01:18.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/service_software_config.py', 'heat/engine/resources/openstack/nova/server.py', 'heat/tests/openstack/nova/test_server.py'], 'message': "Make Server software_config_transport updatable

This change makes it possible to update a server's
software_config_transport property without replacing the server.

Some reasons for wanting to do this with long-running servers include:

- moving to POLL_TEMP_URL to reduce load on the heat engines, or to be
  able to create deployments outside the stack
- moving to ZAQAR_MESSAGE once the host cloud has deployed zaqar

Any existing transport *must* continue working and return up-to-date
data for the lifecycle of the stack since it can't be known when all
servers have switched to the new transport. This means that a transport's
enabled status should be determined by the enabling resource data
rather than the software_config_transport property.

The os-collect-config configuration data needs to ensure that old
transport configurations are disabled. This includes local boot config
which remains on the server for its lifetime, and is outdated once the
transport changes. This disabling is achieved by setting any existing
configuration values to None.

This has been tested on a tripleo cloud by repeatedly switching between
POLL_TEMP_URL and POLL_SERVER_CFN during a stack update and confirming
that os-collect-config switches to the new transport.

Change-Id: I9c475f0c489c67db5895924050186228403f2773
Closes-Bug: #1519609
"}]
commit_message:
Make Server software_config_transport updatable

This change makes it possible to update a server's
software_config_transport property without replacing the server.

Some reasons for wanting to do this with long-running servers include:

- moving to POLL_TEMP_URL to reduce load on the heat engines, or to be
  able to create deployments outside the stack
- moving to ZAQAR_MESSAGE once the host cloud has deployed zaqar

Any existing transport *must* continue working and return up-to-date
data for the lifecycle of the stack since it can't be known when all
servers have switched to the new transport. This means that a transport's
enabled status should be determined by the enabling resource data
rather than the software_config_transport property.

The os-collect-config configuration data needs to ensure that old
transport configurations are disabled. This includes local boot config
which remains on the server for its lifetime, and is outdated once the
transport changes. This disabling is achieved by setting any existing
configuration values to None.

This has been tested on a tripleo cloud by repeatedly switching between
POLL_TEMP_URL and POLL_SERVER_CFN during a stack update and confirming
that os-collect-config switches to the new transport.

Change-Id: I9c475f0c489c67db5895924050186228403f2773
Closes-Bug: #1519609

commit_message:
VIP iptables rules are not hardcoded

The function generate_vips:
*receives input parameters: network_metadata, network_scheme and role
*searches vendor_specific and iptables_rules in network_metadata and
processes them
*recognizes and substitutes authomatically such words: <%INT%>, <%IP%>
and <%CIDR%> in iptables rules

DocImpact:
Change-Id: Ic3fde513ea8b1ccf94305d9d25615471f563779e
Closes-bug: #1517497

commit_message:
Modifying Orion docker package to use MongoDB docker

The Orion context broker needs a MongoDB database to
persist its data. In terms of docker, two dockers (one for orion and
another for mongodb) should be deployed. It is important to
configure correctly orion docker with mongodb docker IP.

Change-Id: Iba09ceb6ad4145913dfcbff5ecff840a498f3d4a

client files with base client classes for v1 and v2 Cinder clients.

commit_message:
Changing directory structure for Cinder clients

The tempest/services/volume directory had the following structure:

        tempest
        |___services
            |___volume
                |____json
                |    |____admin
                |    |    |____<client files>
                |    |
                |    |____<client files>
                |
                |____v2
                     |____json
                          |____admin
                          |    |____<client files>
                          |
                          |____<client files>

The structure was changed to keep consistency with other clients directories.
For example, the tempest/services/identity derectory and the tempest/services/image
directory. So now the structure is the following:

        tempest
        |___services
            |___volume
                |____base
                |    |____<client files>
                |
                |____v1
                |    |____json
                |         |____admin
                |         |    |____<client files>
                |         |
                |         |____<client files>
                |
                |____v2
                     |____json
                          |____admin
                          |    |____<client files>
                          |
                          |____<client files>

The tempest/services/volume/base directory was created and now it containes base
client files with base client classes for v1 and v2 Cinder clients.

Change-Id: I0ac37e15eddffb12d150dcd5b68e0f933712d22c

commit_message:
Unhelpful error message when api-paste.ini is missing

When heat-api fails to find the expected api_paste_config file, it fails
to start and logs the message:
"ERROR: Unable to locate config file"
This message is unhelpful and misleading, since heat.conf has been
found.
Closes-Bug: #1520387
Change-Id: I54a87b10f1f00aa6945bfc131c1aa5dca7a3583f

commit_message:
Allow user to set DIB_RELEASE for disk images

This change has two parts.  First it allows a user to define an
argument to the role that is wraped around diskimage-builder to
add an optional environment variable of DIB_RELEASE to the build
process.

Secondly it sets a default for the test sequence to utilize debian
jessie for the builds to stabilize the non-voting CI test.

Change-Id: Ifbc0f1ce42f3ab9ec73951a813ab0c4a38639550
Closes-Bug: #1521313

commit_message:
Switch to Ansible 2.0

Once Ansible 2.0 is released, we should use it. Updated branch
to be stable-2.0.

An additional driver behind this is the introduction of additional
filters which allow users to combine dictonary values.

Change-Id: I7527ad084e67b5707c4aeeb09fdc9446889d25b6

commit_message:
Fix the parameter order of assertEqual in ceilometerclient

On assertEqual, the parameter order should be (expected, actual).
Some of the tests in ceilometer client were written with invalid
parameter orders.  This patch fixes those tests.

Change-Id: I9a7a81bdb0d9224f2b9cd53b7fb6eaf5ed7a582a
Partial-Bug: 1277104

commit_message:
Support for storing alarms in Cassandra

Store alarms in Cassandra; events and samples will be in a later patch.

This patch uses the hbase (in-memory) driver for events & samples,
so the tests can still pass.

Change-Id: Ibe14857e98d63d827ba6e3e182809a3227f7ab03
Implements: blueprint cassandra-driver

commit_message:
Revert "Optimize gate-project-config-layout"

With this optimization, there are now changes that do
not have any jobs triggered. Revert this change so that we
always run a job...

This reverts commit 61b2a572ebcde1b2986666713250b31a6ec900bd.

Change-Id: I0be479d619086e3326ca288acdae7c0ea0f7a18f

commit_message:
Remove default=None for config options

In the config module default=None is set as the default value,
so it isn't necessary to set it again in the code.

Removal of empty bridges have been disabled [1] to fix a race condition
between Nova and Neutron where a bridge would be removed if
the only instance using it is rebooted. This means empty bridges
will pile up over time.

This script can be used to periodically remove empty bridges by running it
on compute nodes.

Note: Usage of this script can still trigger the original race condition.

on their instances.

[1] Commit 8dd8a7d93564168b98fa2350eedf56acede42b0f

Related-bug: #1328546
Closes-bug: #1497027
Co-Authored-By: Cedric Brandily <zzelle@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Ieb2796381579ad295abf361ce483d979a53d2bd6
(cherry picked from commit 27f60c314bc9de5d81571de1437f93ca232f1382)
"}]
commit_message:
Add neutron-linuxbridge-cleanup util

Removal of empty bridges have been disabled [1] to fix a race condition
between Nova and Neutron where a bridge would be removed if
the only instance using it is rebooted. This means empty bridges
will pile up over time.

This script can be used to periodically remove empty bridges by running it
on compute nodes.

Note: Usage of this script can still trigger the original race condition.
It should be used when you don't expect anyone do be doing operations
on their instances.

[1] Commit 8dd8a7d93564168b98fa2350eedf56acede42b0f

DocImpact: Add neutron-linuxbridge-cleanup util
Related-bug: #1328546
Closes-bug: #1497027
Co-Authored-By: Cedric Brandily <zzelle@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Ieb2796381579ad295abf361ce483d979a53d2bd6
(cherry picked from commit 27f60c314bc9de5d81571de1437f93ca232f1382)

commit_message:
Support Unicode request_id on Python 3

The oslo.context change If48ee7f4d1c113f1f26b3b1698c6b055807b950f
will change request_id type on Python 3 from bytes to str. This
change prepares Neutron for this change.

Change-Id: I872c268ef5f17dc2c1fe0ce8aa7e8af4ebc1d757

subject: Fix status code returned from API
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-12-02 05:08:28.000000000', 'files': ['senlin/tests/unit/apiv1/test_routes.py', 'senlin/api/openstack/v1/__init__.py', 'senlin/common/wsgi.py'], 'message': "Fix status code returned from API

This patch adds a status code 'success' that represents a success
reponse a user can expect from the senlin-api. The default status code
(as implicitly specifed) in webob.Response is 200. This new status code
overrides that for a better conformance with the guidelines from the
api-wg project. When there is no guidelines for reference, we refer to
the HTTP protocol specification for definition.

Change-Id: I787739ab071bfbe70abeca8f8dc98f2e3ece8d05
partial-blueprint: http-response-modification
"}]
commit_message:
Fix status code returned from API

This patch adds a status code 'success' that represents a success
reponse a user can expect from the senlin-api. The default status code
(as implicitly specifed) in webob.Response is 200. This new status code
overrides that for a better conformance with the guidelines from the
api-wg project. When there is no guidelines for reference, we refer to
the HTTP protocol specification for definition.

Change-Id: I787739ab071bfbe70abeca8f8dc98f2e3ece8d05
partial-blueprint: http-response-modification

commit_message:
Adding support for Discovery calls

Support for the DiscoveryNew and DiscoverDelete methods as
defined in the libnetwork released with Docker 1.9.0 is added.
Neutron does not require using such informaton. Nor is it capable
of using such information with its current API.

Change-Id: Icca7858e2f0f5c686a841f4611b9e2cfc9a47368

For a DVR router, when it updates router gateway_ip, it should not
reschedule the l3 agents running on compute nodes whose mode is dvr,
it just need to reschedule the l3 agents running on network nodes
whose mode is dvr_snat.

Change-Id: Ib8ea6797c88cefb473eff9a8a7b2517a6aa90ca4
Closes-bug: #1496204
Co-Authored-By: Oleg Bondarev <obondarev@mirantis.com>
"}]
commit_message:
DVR:don't reschedule the l3 agent running on compute node

For a DVR router, when it updates router gateway_ip, it should not
reschedule the l3 agents running on compute nodes whose mode is dvr,
it just need to reschedule the l3 agents running on network nodes
whose mode is dvr_snat.

Change-Id: Ib8ea6797c88cefb473eff9a8a7b2517a6aa90ca4
Closes-bug: #1496204
Co-Authored-By: Oleg Bondarev <obondarev@mirantis.com>

subject: Fixed _NO_DATA_ insertion even when data was present
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-11-27 05:47:27.000000000', 'files': ['cloudkitty/storage/__init__.py', 'cloudkitty/storage/sqlalchemy/__init__.py'], 'message': 'Fixed _NO_DATA_ insertion even when data was present

State tracking was a little bit sloppy.
The _has_data flag was global and not per tenant.
The dates where not always cleaned on commit leading to false
calculation.

Change-Id: Ie1fc70ba0335f1fc351d41675e28abea835082d1
Closes-Bug: #1511206
'}]
commit_message:
Fixed _NO_DATA_ insertion even when data was present

State tracking was a little bit sloppy.
The _has_data flag was global and not per tenant.
The dates where not always cleaned on commit leading to false
calculation.

Change-Id: Ie1fc70ba0335f1fc351d41675e28abea835082d1
Closes-Bug: #1511206

commit_message:
Cleanup unused test code in test_scheduler.py

In test_scheduler.py, the test class `SchedulerInstanceGroupData` do not
have any test methods. So remove it.

This test class is originally introduced in the change
I539424192727cf2a768d6b24ba9cf36dc56c9304. But between patch 35 and 36,
all the tests in this class are removed except for the class itself.

Change-Id: Ie5e52442bab97b3ef77d8085129a18881591077b

commit_message:
[config-ref] Consolidate IBM driver reference

Streamline documentation:
* Follow usual practice of giving code snippets for configuration files.
* Do not mention obvious things like that a restart of a server is needed.
* Remove optional settings, the configuration table contains all settings.

Change-Id: I21699db334c48f36b2b6a065a129130026b5d591

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2015-09-14 09:36:42.000000000', 'files': ['doc/install-guide/source/neutron-compute-node.rst'], 'message': 'Add a note about graceful ovs-agent restart

When restarting the neutron-plugin-openvswitch-agent prior to the
Liberty release, the agent would drop all existing flows. This
behaviour would break all networking until the agent recreates
the flows. Now, the neutron-plugin-openvswitch-agent only drops
the old flows when you restart it, reducing the impact on
networking.

Change-Id: I00b06b999e010fc34455b77d6006da7697491465
Closes-bug: #1487250
'}]
commit_message:
Add a note about graceful ovs-agent restart

When restarting the neutron-plugin-openvswitch-agent prior to the
Liberty release, the agent would drop all existing flows. This
behaviour would break all networking until the agent recreates
the flows. Now, the neutron-plugin-openvswitch-agent only drops
the old flows when you restart it, reducing the impact on
networking.

Change-Id: I00b06b999e010fc34455b77d6006da7697491465
Closes-bug: #1487250

subject: Refactor deps to use extras and env markers
revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2015-11-30 17:01:36.000000000', 'files': ['test-requirements.txt', 'setup.cfg', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'Refactor deps to use extras and env markers

Adds extras for e.g. nova to use for testing, so that oslo.db can
control the libraries used.

Removes test-requirements.txt - it becomes a single env-marker
controlled list, and shows how tox will access those dependencies.

Co-Authored-By: Roman Podoliaka <rpodolyaka@mirantis.com>

Change-Id: I97ef5bad215abe60d92c3fda4474c48ccb13eab0
'}]
commit_message:
Refactor deps to use extras and env markers

Adds extras for e.g. nova to use for testing, so that oslo.db can
control the libraries used.

Removes test-requirements.txt - it becomes a single env-marker
controlled list, and shows how tox will access those dependencies.

Co-Authored-By: Roman Podoliaka <rpodolyaka@mirantis.com>

Change-Id: I97ef5bad215abe60d92c3fda4474c48ccb13eab0

This directory contains eggs that were downloaded by setuptools
to build, test, and run plug-ins.

This directory caches those eggs to prevent repeated downloads.

We need to ignore it.

Change-Id: Idd164c7c8952c70487253e5691ba2da33345059a
'}]
commit_message:
ignore .eggs directory

This directory contains eggs that were downloaded by setuptools
to build, test, and run plug-ins.

This directory caches those eggs to prevent repeated downloads.

We need to ignore it.

Change-Id: Idd164c7c8952c70487253e5691ba2da33345059a

subject: test_logging_error: build a logger at the test level
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-01 11:15:43.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_log/tests/unit/fixture/test_logging_error.py'], 'message': "test_logging_error: build a logger at the test level

test_logging_error calls getLogger at the module level and thus
a logger gets permanently inserted into the _loggers dict and is
visible in all other tests.
As tests shouldn't affect each other, a logger creation should be
moved to the TestLoggingFixture class setUp method.

Change-Id: I8e988c88cc1ffaf53bd3c97607f16fc2a8078d12
"}]
commit_message:
test_logging_error: build a logger at the test level

test_logging_error calls getLogger at the module level and thus
a logger gets permanently inserted into the _loggers dict and is
visible in all other tests.
As tests shouldn't affect each other, a logger creation should be
moved to the TestLoggingFixture class setUp method.

Change-Id: I8e988c88cc1ffaf53bd3c97607f16fc2a8078d12

notification via Kafka. This driver is experimental
until having functional and integration tests

Whenever creating volume fails because of exceeding quota, there

commit_message:
Log exception when exceeding quota

Whenever creating volume fails because of exceeding quota, there
was just a warning message (without traceback) printed on the logs.
Horizon doesn't give much details either except the message
"Unable to create volume". This makes debugging hard.
Changing the log level from warning to exception for these error
paths.

Change-Id: Id8ca416e6734cf3f472831cd5fef82e7fbe0d432

subject: make generate_uuid return valid uuid
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-11-12 23:04:57.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/event_concept.rst', 'requirements.txt', 'doc/source/specification/events.rst', 'pycadf/identifier.py'], 'message': 'make generate_uuid return valid uuid

original design prepended a namespace to the beginning of uuid.
this scoped the uuid to a namespace but it is technically invalid.

this patch drops the behaviour of prepending string. rather, it
takes the namespace, hashes it, and uses uuid v5 to generate valid
uuid based on that namespace

Change-Id: Ibde222c91522fa3c4a1720b6a8da81dac31560b9
Closes-Bug: #1504889
'}]
commit_message:
make generate_uuid return valid uuid

original design prepended a namespace to the beginning of uuid.
this scoped the uuid to a namespace but it is technically invalid.

this patch drops the behaviour of prepending string. rather, it
takes the namespace, hashes it, and uses uuid v5 to generate valid
uuid based on that namespace

Change-Id: Ibde222c91522fa3c4a1720b6a8da81dac31560b9
Closes-Bug: #1504889

subject: Fix Resource.__eq__ mismatch semantics of object equal
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-12-01 11:58:19.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometerclient/openstack/common/apiclient/base.py', 'ceilometerclient/tests/unit/test_openstack_common.py'], 'message': "Fix Resource.__eq__ mismatch semantics of object equal

The __eq__ of apiclient.base.Resource will return True,
if the two objects have same id, even if they have different
other attributes value. The behavior is weird and don't
match the semantics of object equal. The objects that have
different value should be different objects.
Fix this issue and add some test cases in this patch.

Change-Id: Ieb28aa179bda945686e0d9c2f341c373ce2bab74
Closes-Bug: #1499369
"}]
commit_message:
Fix Resource.__eq__ mismatch semantics of object equal

The __eq__ of apiclient.base.Resource will return True,
if the two objects have same id, even if they have different
other attributes value. The behavior is weird and don't
match the semantics of object equal. The objects that have
different value should be different objects.
Fix this issue and add some test cases in this patch.

Change-Id: Ieb28aa179bda945686e0d9c2f341c373ce2bab74
Closes-Bug: #1499369

Instead of repeatedly extraction of engine options in

Change-Id: I4d24f7badef61fdd69db22f59931c374c32986ff
'}]
commit_message:
Move engine options extraction to __init__ methods

Instead of repeatedly extraction of engine options in
local functions/methods, just extract the currently
used options once (in using objects __init__ methods).

This saves some repeated extraction and establishes
the pattern of where engine options should be extracted
going forward.

Change-Id: I4d24f7badef61fdd69db22f59931c374c32986ff

commit_message:
Use stevedore directive to document plugins

The point behind the addition of the stevedore.sphinxext extension is
"to document drivers and other types of plugins to make the available
sets built into projects easier to discover"(dhellman).

More details in the ML thread at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-August/073338.html

Change-Id: Ib1d4c23a64cbd0010c88ff77b97b1173da302bed

commit_message:
linux_net.metadata_accept(): IPv6 support

Even when using Neutron, Nova permits access to metadata service via
iptables firewall.  When metadata_ip configuration option contains IPv6
address, ip6tables should be used.

Add IPv6 support to linux_net.metadata_accept().  Remove -s 0.0.0.0/0
from IPv4 iptables rule because it is redundant, which allows to use
same rule syntax for IPv4 and IPv6.

Conflicts:
        nova/tests/unit/network/test_linux_net.py

Change-Id: Ibd5830150011361edcaf3b06b01590087f295d03
Closes-Bug: #1425103
(cherry picked from commit ea5474d6051cb7c10b5a9ea5e1bcaeb060695a95)

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-06-12 12:14:23.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/compute/test_compute_mgr.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py', 'nova/tests/compute/test_resource_tracker.py', 'nova/compute/resource_tracker.py'], 'message': "Fix race between resource audit and cpu pinning

This fixes a race between the claimed CPUs of an instance being
persisted to the DB, and the resource audit scanning the DB for
instances and subtracting pinned CPUs from the list of available CPUs.

The problem only shows up when the following sequence happens:
1) instance A (with dedicated cpus) boots on a compute node
2) resource audit runs on that compute node
3) instance B (with dedicated cpus) boots on the same compute node

The bug is that the claimed numa topology isn't updated until
after we release COMPUTE_RESOURCES_SEMAPHORE, so when the resource
audit retrieves the list of instances the numa_topology hasn't
been updated yet for the most recent one.

The fix is to persist the claimed numa topology before releasing
COMPUTE_RESOURCES_SEMAPHORE.

Closes-Bug: #1454451
Co-Authored-By: Dan Smith <dansmith@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 2427d288bc017a5b91430ffe16419d47703d2060)

	nova/compute/manager.py
	nova/tests/compute/test_resource_tracker.py

Change-Id: I553f2e43a68577c83d890c3671380af68f9e725a
"}]
commit_message:
Fix race between resource audit and cpu pinning

This fixes a race between the claimed CPUs of an instance being
persisted to the DB, and the resource audit scanning the DB for
instances and subtracting pinned CPUs from the list of available CPUs.

The problem only shows up when the following sequence happens:
1) instance A (with dedicated cpus) boots on a compute node
2) resource audit runs on that compute node
3) instance B (with dedicated cpus) boots on the same compute node

The bug is that the claimed numa topology isn't updated until
after we release COMPUTE_RESOURCES_SEMAPHORE, so when the resource
audit retrieves the list of instances the numa_topology hasn't
been updated yet for the most recent one.

The fix is to persist the claimed numa topology before releasing
COMPUTE_RESOURCES_SEMAPHORE.

Closes-Bug: #1454451
Co-Authored-By: Dan Smith <dansmith@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 2427d288bc017a5b91430ffe16419d47703d2060)

Conflicts:
	nova/compute/manager.py
	nova/tests/compute/test_resource_tracker.py
	nova/tests/unit/compute/test_tracker.py

Change-Id: I553f2e43a68577c83d890c3671380af68f9e725a

commit_message:
libvirt: handle code=38 + sigkill (ebusy) in destroy()

Handle the libvirt error during destroy when the sigkill fails due to an
EBUSY. This is taken from a comment by danpb in the bug report as a
potential workaround.

Co-authored-by: Daniel Berrange (berrange@redhat.com)

Closes-Bug: #1353939

Conflicts:
    (From stable/kilo)
    nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py

    NOTE (kashyapc): 'stable/kilo' branch doesn't have the
    'libvirt_guest' object, so, adjust the below unit tests accordingly:

        test_private_destroy_ebusy_timeout
        test_private_destroy_ebusy_multiple_attempt_ok

    (For stable/juno)
    nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py

    NOTE (wolsen): 'stable/juno' branch required had slightly different
    means to access domain objects in test case, so adjust tests
    accordingly.

Change-Id: I128bf6b939fbbc85df521fd3fe23c3c6f93b1b2c
(cherry picked from commit 3907867601d1044eaadebff68a590d176abff6cf)

commit_message:
DO NOT MERGE: Extra logging for lxc teardown fail.

lxc teardown is failing due to inability to remove
instance directory. Open files in directory that used
to hold container filesystem. Add extra logging to see what
files are open and if the container filesystem is still mounted.

Related-Bug: #1491563

Depends-On: Ief8edef0df8da1a6ee94aafa9ceaf96da5e3211b

Change-Id: Id0cccdb5897a30eacbb3000e3b4a6b93d42e9a1f

commit_message:
Use host AZ instead of instance AZ in availability zone filter

Instance availability zone in db may not always be consistent with availability
zone of its host. Scheduler may refuse to resize an instance if availability
zones are inconsistent. Availability zone filter need to use host availability
zone, if an instance already reaches a host.

Change-Id: I015143cdf99f2a3a3829d21525869babddc545ba
Closes-Bug: 1444841

subject: Store the actual UUID of obj_id in Senlin database for webhook create
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-12-02 02:51:54.000000000', 'files': ['senlin/engine/service.py', 'senlin/tests/unit/engine/service/test_webhooks.py'], 'message': "Store the actual UUID of obj_id in Senlin database for webhook create

In 'webhook' DB table, it has a field named 'obj_id' to reference a
target which the webhook will act on. Now if we create a webhook
 with target name, then it will store the target name in the 'obj_id'
field of 'webhook' table. Triggering this webhook maybe lead to
unexpected result. An example is as following.

   1. Create the first cluster named 'cluster1'
   2. Create webhook on 'cluster1' with CLUSTER_SCALE_OUT action
   3. Delete the cluster1
   4. Create a second cluster also names 'cluster1'
   5. Trigger the webhook which will result in scaling out the
      second cluster.

Change-Id: Idf2d27d7f16535a52fbf6c59f1c997e4e0728c89
Closes-Bug: #1521049
"}]
commit_message:
Store the actual UUID of obj_id in Senlin database for webhook create

In 'webhook' DB table, it has a field named 'obj_id' to reference a
target which the webhook will act on. Now if we create a webhook
 with target name, then it will store the target name in the 'obj_id'
field of 'webhook' table. Triggering this webhook maybe lead to
unexpected result. An example is as following.

   1. Create the first cluster named 'cluster1'
   2. Create webhook on 'cluster1' with CLUSTER_SCALE_OUT action
   3. Delete the cluster1
   4. Create a second cluster also names 'cluster1'
   5. Trigger the webhook which will result in scaling out the
      second cluster.

Change-Id: Idf2d27d7f16535a52fbf6c59f1c997e4e0728c89
Closes-Bug: #1521049

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-07-08 12:27:05.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/config.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_config.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/imagebackend.py'], 'message': 'Add support for burstable disk IO control

This commit extends the existing instance disk IO controls to
include 6 more parameters: disk_{read,write}_{disk,iops}_max.

These parameters can be used in combination with the existing
disk_{read,write}_{disk,iops} flavor options to implement
burstiness.

Example:
  nova flavor-set m1.medium set disk_total_bytes_sec=10240000
  nova flavor-set m1.medium set disk_total_bytes_sec_max=20480000

  With the above, the instances with m1.medium flavor will have
  an average total I/O write limit of 10MB/s, with the ability
  to burst to 20MB/s periodically.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I287ae84490e648062958856b7e45b5b1ec47b0b2
'}]
commit_message:
Add support for burstable disk IO control

This commit extends the existing instance disk IO controls to
include 6 more parameters: disk_{read,write}_{disk,iops}_max.

These parameters can be used in combination with the existing
disk_{read,write}_{disk,iops} flavor options to implement
burstiness.

Example:
  nova flavor-set m1.medium set disk_total_bytes_sec=10240000
  nova flavor-set m1.medium set disk_total_bytes_sec_max=20480000

  With the above, the instances with m1.medium flavor will have
  an average total I/O write limit of 10MB/s, with the ability
  to burst to 20MB/s periodically.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I287ae84490e648062958856b7e45b5b1ec47b0b2

commit_message:
Add "LXD" to the lxd of known hypervisors

nova-compute-lxd is an out of tree driver, but it is being used
by more people. It is useful for people who want to use system
containers.

Change-Id: Ic9e59758917535a50aec0ded840eae6c440cda8c
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>

commit_message:
Add class TestServerList to provide basic unit test for "server list" command.

This patch provide a class to test "server list" command. Only one simplest
case in this patch.

Some of the options in "server list" are complicated. And the server object
contains lots of attributes need to be handled in specific ways. So other
test cases will be added in other patches.

Change-Id: Id9fdba8f149bd74187aa42516067dacebc6962b5
Implements: blueprint osc-unit-test-framework-improvement

commit_message:
Enable setup_servers_mock() to take attributes param.

setup_servers_mock() is now able to set methods to the fake servers.
But it cannot set attributes. This patch enable it to do so.

This will be useful in "server list" test cases.

Change-Id: Ic30d750ebe4650244707a368cdd5d622a8f1b8ed
Implements: blueprint osc-unit-test-framework-improvement

commit_message:
Pass environment variables of proxy to tox

When a development environment is under a proxy, tox is failed even if
environment variables of the proxy are set.
This problem has been solved on the other projects with the commit
I0045cb2253a4d102196fdab277462891a886fe3a.
This patch fixes this problem.

Change-Id: I255c047b52a00c0feeadb865238c79dedb8ac270
Closes-Bug: #1465086

commit_message:
Correct disk usages for boot-from-volume instances

Added 'is_booted_from_vol' method in instance object to check
if instance is booted from volume.

If instance is booted from volume then do not update 'local_gb_used'
resource. Also do not pass 'disk_gb' limit to 'Claim' if instance is
booted from volume.

Closes-Bug: #1334974
Change-Id: Id9564fa6b50a2dee927c4e5532a522d6d30fa70f

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-26 01:19:53.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/common/middleware/test_slo.py', 'swift/common/swob.py', 'swift/common/request_helpers.py'], 'message': 'Fix crash when a SLO repeats a segment.

If a SLO manifest specified the same segment twice with no range on
the latter, we would crash while trying to coalesce the segment
specifications into a single request (for efficiency). Now we handle
that missing range and do the right thing.

Change-Id: If13af444ed301ebd8fd34a0d96a330ded648f0c4
'}]
commit_message:
Fix crash when a SLO repeats a segment.

If a SLO manifest specified the same segment twice with no range on
the latter, we would crash while trying to coalesce the segment
specifications into a single request (for efficiency). Now we handle
that missing range and do the right thing.

Change-Id: If13af444ed301ebd8fd34a0d96a330ded648f0c4

commit_message:
Remove two unneeded db lookups during delete of a resizing instance

Now that flavor info is stored in instance extra we can avoid two extra
db lookups during delete of a resizing instance by getting old flavor
from instance extra.

Change-Id: Id6f4982d7cd90b9d212d215382510c70775a99f3

Hyper-V: refines the exceptions raised in the driver

The exceptions raised in the HyperVDriver are too generic.
This commit addresses this issue.

Partially Implements: blueprint add-os-win-library

subject: Add check for OVS to be up before starting L3 agent
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-12-02 02:25:33.000000000', 'files': ['labs/osbash/scripts/ubuntu/setup_neutron_network.sh'], 'message': 'Add check for OVS to be up before starting L3 agent

Neutron L3 agent can only be started when OVS is fully up.
So far this was handled by a simple sleep (1 sec), but it
can take considerably longer than that.
This patch adds a check for OVS to be up.

Change-Id: Iedb4626bec8d8b6d5e23a0936ca41b32eb702aa3
'}]
commit_message:
Add check for OVS to be up before starting L3 agent

Neutron L3 agent can only be started when OVS is fully up.
So far this was handled by a simple sleep (1 sec), but it
can take considerably longer than that.
This patch adds a check for OVS to be up.

Change-Id: Iedb4626bec8d8b6d5e23a0936ca41b32eb702aa3

While projects run different versions of pylint, astroid which is a

Capping the version until pylint/astroid projects fix the issue their

commit_message:
Cap astroid to unbreak pylint.

While projects run different versions of pylint, astroid which is a
pylint dependency has done an API breaking point release - 1.4.{0,1}
breaks pylint 1.4.4.

Capping the version until pylint/astroid projects fix the issue their
side.

Upstream bug url: https://bitbucket.org/logilab/astroid/issues/275/140-and-141-fail-to-work-with-pylint-144

nb: the upstream response is that astroid 1.4 is deliberately breaking
and should have been 2.0.

Change-Id: Iaf2c5dbb92cacbc236083f8f6926a426bfb28f21

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-12-01 18:29:33.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'message': "Cap astroid to unbreak pylint.

While projects run different versions of pylint, astroid which is a pylint
dependency has done an API breaking point release - 1.4.{0,1} breaks pylint
1.4.4. Upstream say they should have called it 2.x :/.

Since this is a stable branch, I'm just capping everything, we have no
expectation of projects in stable branches revising their pylint versions.

The pylint version chosen is the highest before the break occurs,
which since it was previously an open range would have been used by
test runs.

Upstream bug url: https://bitbucket.org/logilab/astroid/issues/275/140-and-141-fail-to-work-with-pylint-144

Change-Id: Iaf2c5dbb92cacbc236083f8f6926a426bfb28f21
"}]
commit_message:
Cap astroid to unbreak pylint.

While projects run different versions of pylint, astroid which is a pylint
dependency has done an API breaking point release - 1.4.{0,1} breaks pylint
1.4.4. Upstream say they should have called it 2.x :/.

Since this is a stable branch, I'm just capping everything, we have no
expectation of projects in stable branches revising their pylint versions.

The pylint version chosen is the highest before the break occurs,
which since it was previously an open range would have been used by
test runs.

Upstream bug url: https://bitbucket.org/logilab/astroid/issues/275/140-and-141-fail-to-work-with-pylint-144

Change-Id: Iaf2c5dbb92cacbc236083f8f6926a426bfb28f21

commit_message:
Pass environment variables of proxy to tox

When a development environment is under a proxy, tox is failed even if
environment variables of the proxy are set.
This patch fixes this problem.
See Also: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/191600

Change-Id: I9e18d42f08b97300b52d27652c7b799ec2a26190

commit_message:
Add parameters for Neutron QoS support

Quality of Service advanced service is a feature introduced in Liberty.
This patch adds options required for this service deployment:
- ml2-ovs extensions (to use qos extension)
- ml2-sriov extensions (to use qos extension)
- ml2 plugin extension_drivers (to use qos extension driver)
- qos notification drivers

Change-Id: Iefc289a6eee13b9c66f8131c258af982f232df4b

subject: Remove dependency on neutron for topics
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-01 19:29:24.000000000', 'files': ['neutron_lbaas/services/loadbalancer/drivers/common/agent_driver_base.py', 'neutron_lbaas/services/loadbalancer/constants.py', 'neutron_lbaas/services/loadbalancer/agent/agent_manager.py', 'neutron_lbaas/services/loadbalancer/agent/agent.py'], 'message': 'Remove dependency on neutron for topics

LBaaS uses LOADBALANCER_PLUGIN and LOADBALANCER_AGENT from neutron topics.py.
Copying these to LBaaS project, as not used in neutron, and will remove from
neutron later.

Also, see LOADBALANCER and LOADBALANCERV2. The former is only used in neutron
tests (so copying to LBaaS project). The latter is not used in neutron,
so placing here and it can be removed from neutron later.

The goal here is to chip away at removing dependencies on the neutron
repo. This is just one simple case to clean up some unneeded references.

Placed the literals in existing constants file in LBaaS project.

Change-Id: I62bfd6b34c381427425ca2a656e5782087de3a3b
Implements: blueprint neutron-lib
'}]
commit_message:
Remove dependency on neutron for topics

LBaaS uses LOADBALANCER_PLUGIN and LOADBALANCER_AGENT from neutron topics.py.
Copying these to LBaaS project, as not used in neutron, and will remove from
neutron later.

Also, see LOADBALANCER and LOADBALANCERV2. The former is only used in neutron
tests (so copying to LBaaS project). The latter is not used in neutron,
so placing here and it can be removed from neutron later.

The goal here is to chip away at removing dependencies on the neutron
repo. This is just one simple case to clean up some unneeded references.

Placed the literals in existing constants file in LBaaS project.

Change-Id: I62bfd6b34c381427425ca2a656e5782087de3a3b
Implements: blueprint neutron-lib

When you create a network you can specify it as

It is nice to enhance the network tab to add a

commit_message:
Networks tab does not show external configuration

When you create a network you can specify it as
external network. When the network is listed
in Horizon 'Networks' tab, we do not see any
column indicating if network is 'external' .
It is nice to enhance the network tab to add a
new column showing 'external' indicating whether
network is 'external'.

Change-Id: I6d07ffc0d2584bbf8bd6c25aee660f87c385e737
Closes-Bug:#1350237

subject: Cache runtime metadata in the graph (vs externally)
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-12-01 22:34:31.000000000', 'files': ['taskflow/engines/action_engine/runtime.py'], 'message': 'Cache runtime metadata in the graph (vs externally)

Instead of having the runtime object maintain its own local
cache of atom names to runtime metadata we can just take advantage
of the fact that the graph object we use already provides a space
for node metadata and use it instead (which we already use for
other metadata).

This makes it easier to traverse the graph and analyze this info
when debugging, when doing other activities and so-on.

Change-Id: I28f8fed51fbffd91a517550fc01ac8f5904e455b
'}]
commit_message:
Cache runtime metadata in the graph (vs externally)

Instead of having the runtime object maintain its own local
cache of atom names to runtime metadata we can just take advantage
of the fact that the graph object we use already provides a space
for node metadata and use it instead (which we already use for
other metadata).

This makes it easier to traverse the graph and analyze this info
when debugging, when doing other activities and so-on.

Change-Id: I28f8fed51fbffd91a517550fc01ac8f5904e455b

commit_message:
Make API Document Code-Blocks Consistent

Makes all Code-Blocks with REST calls to be formatted with
javascript as the language. This allows for types to be
highlighted. This patch as includes some fixes to the titles.

Closes-Bug: #1520118

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-01 02:24:45.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/manager.py', 'cinder/scheduler/filters/capabilities_filter.py', 'cinder/scheduler/host_manager.py'], 'message': '[POC] Volume support for multi hypervisors

In multi hypervisor OpenStack environment using such as
KVM, VMware, Hyper-V etc, we need to provide Cinder storage
backends corresponding to these hypervisors for booting an
instance from a volume. For example, VMware needs VMDK Cinder
backend, Hyper-V needs Windows Cinder backend and also KVM
needs supported backends such as LVM, ceph etc. KVM can't
boot from VMDK backend.

However, there is no way to specify storage backend when user
boot an instance from a volume. As a result, the boot volume
might be created on unrelated backend then the volume boot
will fail.

To boot an instance from specific combination between
hypervisor and storage backend properly, Cinder needs to
know which hypervisor will handle the volume and then
Cinder should schedule volume creation to proper storage
backend based on the hypervisor type.

Cinder filter scheduler has hint keyword mechanism, so that
user can specify target "hypervisor_type" to deploy new
instance via scheduler hint when creates a new volume.

DocImpact
Blueprint: volume-support-for-multi-hypervisors
Change-Id: If8ee8800d2258c6cd29811ba4260b2953128d0cd
'}]
commit_message:
[POC] Volume support for multi hypervisors

In multi hypervisor OpenStack environment using such as
KVM, VMware, Hyper-V etc, we need to provide Cinder storage
backends corresponding to these hypervisors for booting an
instance from a volume. For example, VMware needs VMDK Cinder
backend, Hyper-V needs Windows Cinder backend and also KVM
needs supported backends such as LVM, ceph etc. KVM can't
boot from VMDK backend.

However, there is no way to specify storage backend when user
boot an instance from a volume. As a result, the boot volume
might be created on unrelated backend then the volume boot
will fail.

To boot an instance from specific combination between
hypervisor and storage backend properly, Cinder needs to
know which hypervisor will handle the volume and then
Cinder should schedule volume creation to proper storage
backend based on the hypervisor type.

Cinder filter scheduler has hint keyword mechanism, so that
user can specify target "hypervisor_type" to deploy new
instance via scheduler hint when creates a new volume.

DocImpact
Blueprint: volume-support-for-multi-hypervisors
Change-Id: If8ee8800d2258c6cd29811ba4260b2953128d0cd

commit_message:
Kilo: Support public snapshot

Provide a mean to create public snapshots, similar to glance's public images.
So list snapshots will output your own snapshots and public snapshots. All
these snapshots can be used to create volume.

bp public-snapshot

Change-Id: I5123a5d6a15f9b030fb726e5c4ee87f26e3d6eba
