subject: Add dcos library
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-11-27 06:45:46.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt', 'upper-constraints.txt'], 'message': "Add dcos library

The project kolla-mesos needs a dcos library for communication
with Mesos. This is an essential requirement for it.

Is the library actively maintained?
===================================

Yes, it's an active project on Github [1] with the latest release
from 19th Oct. [2]

Is the library good code?
=========================

It's mostly covered by unit tests and PEP8 compatible.

Is the library python 3 compatible?
===================================

Yes, it uses six library for compatibility with Py 3.x. Both
Py 2.7 and 3.4 are tested.

Is the library license compatible?
==================================

Yes, it's licensed under Apache License 2.0.

Is the library already packaged in the distros we target?
=========================================================

No, but packaging it would be simple. Furthermore, this library
will be used only in kolla-mesos project, which is in very early
development phase and will have to be packaged too in future.

Is the function of this library already covered by other libraries?
===================================================================

No, there is no library interacting with Mesos in global requirements.

[1] https://github.com/mesosphere/dcos-cli
[2] https://github.com/mesosphere/dcos-cli/releases/tag/0.2.0

Change-Id: Idf4ac1c714094d91885f0918dc276b21d73e9e3b
"}]
commit_message:
Add dcos library

The project kolla-mesos needs a dcos library for communication
with Mesos. This is an essential requirement for it.

Is the library actively maintained?
===================================

Yes, it's an active project on Github [1] with the latest release
from 19th Oct. [2]

Is the library good code?
=========================

It's mostly covered by unit tests and PEP8 compatible.

Is the library python 3 compatible?
===================================

Yes, it uses six library for compatibility with Py 3.x. Both
Py 2.7 and 3.4 are tested.

Is the library license compatible?
==================================

Yes, it's licensed under Apache License 2.0.

Is the library already packaged in the distros we target?
=========================================================

No, but packaging it would be simple. Furthermore, this library
will be used only in kolla-mesos project, which is in very early
development phase and will have to be packaged too in future.

Is the function of this library already covered by other libraries?
===================================================================

No, there is no library interacting with Mesos in global requirements.

[1] https://github.com/mesosphere/dcos-cli
[2] https://github.com/mesosphere/dcos-cli/releases/tag/0.2.0

Change-Id: Idf4ac1c714094d91885f0918dc276b21d73e9e3b

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-01 00:44:21.000000000', 'files': ['trove/tests/unittests/trove_testtools.py', 'trove/tests/root_logger.py'], 'message': "Change reporting of unhandled logging

Unhandled logging messages generated from sources other than Trove's
tests were flooding the log with numerous messages that included
complete backtraces. These backtraces are over 150mb when you run tox
-e py27. Unfortunately, while they are an indication of a problem,
they are most often not things that can be fixed in the Trove project.

To fix this, at least in the short term, this change only reports
anything if the logged message is coming from the context of a test.

Also, this change disables back traces in the messages being reported
unless an optional enables_backtrace is set. By default it set to
False and can only be enabled with a code change (i.e. no
configuration setting).

Change-Id: I9452f03bdd5365991e3c4831aa4936de3713612e
Closes-Bug: 1521373
"}]
commit_message:
Change reporting of unhandled logging

Unhandled logging messages generated from sources other than Trove's
tests were flooding the log with numerous messages that included
complete backtraces. These backtraces are over 150mb when you run tox
-e py27. Unfortunately, while they are an indication of a problem,
they are most often not things that can be fixed in the Trove project.

To fix this, at least in the short term, this change only reports
anything if the logged message is coming from the context of a test.

Also, this change disables back traces in the messages being reported
unless an optional enables_backtrace is set. By default it set to
False and can only be enabled with a code change (i.e. no
configuration setting).

Change-Id: I9452f03bdd5365991e3c4831aa4936de3713612e
Closes-Bug: 1521373

commit_message:
Port run_tests.py to Python 3

* Replace urllib import with six.moves.urllib
* gettext.install() doesn't require the unicode parameter on Python 3
* tox.ini: add py34 testenv

Tests don't pass. It's the very first step to start the working on
porting Trove to Python 3.

Partially implements: blueprint trove-python3
Change-Id: Ide9ec1d2aee84905c03cacdb3ea35d0dcbf01596

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-11-23 18:10:16.000000000', 'files': ['tools/colorizer.py', 'run_tempest.sh'], 'message': "Switch run_tempest.sh to use subunit-trace

This commit switches the run_tempest.sh script to use subunit-trace
instead of the colorizer output filter. Since the colorizer isn't used
anymore it is removed.

The colorizer output has several issues. Firstly the color is actually
meaningless. It's based on arbitrary run times for the tests but don't
actually indicate anything useful. Additionally, it lacks a lot of the
debugging information that subunit-trace provides. Things like skip
messages, the worker breakdown, etc. are missing with the colorizor
output. The last aspect is that switching to use subunit-trace will
provide a consistent output format for running tempest whether you
use tox or run_tempest.sh.

Change-Id: I26e9c45f8e674bdb889b6bc65ad30c4abf6e7655
"}]
commit_message:
Switch run_tempest.sh to use subunit-trace

This commit switches the run_tempest.sh script to use subunit-trace
instead of the colorizer output filter. Since the colorizer isn't used
anymore it is removed.

The colorizer output has several issues. Firstly the color is actually
meaningless. It's based on arbitrary run times for the tests but don't
actually indicate anything useful. Additionally, it lacks a lot of the
debugging information that subunit-trace provides. Things like skip
messages, the worker breakdown, etc. are missing with the colorizor
output. The last aspect is that switching to use subunit-trace will
provide a consistent output format for running tempest whether you
use tox or run_tempest.sh.

Change-Id: I26e9c45f8e674bdb889b6bc65ad30c4abf6e7655

[{'number': 12, 'created': '2015-12-01 00:46:51.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/extensions/test_l3.py', 'neutron/db/l3_db.py'], 'message': 'l3_db: it updates port attribute without L2 plugin

L3_NAT_dbonly_mixin._add_interface_by_port update Port.owner
db entry directly without notifying l2 plugin.
Thus L2 plugin/ML2 mechanism driver will be confused when
interface is attached to router by port because port owner is different.
Use L2 plugin update_port method to update port:owner.

Change-Id: If0178887282456842b6078a851a9233cb58a391a
Closes-Bug: #1475093
'}]
commit_message:
l3_db: it updates port attribute without L2 plugin

L3_NAT_dbonly_mixin._add_interface_by_port update Port.owner
db entry directly without notifying l2 plugin.
Thus L2 plugin/ML2 mechanism driver will be confused when
interface is attached to router by port because port owner is different.
Use L2 plugin update_port method to update port:owner.

Change-Id: If0178887282456842b6078a851a9233cb58a391a
Closes-Bug: #1475093

commit_message:
fix few pieces of inaccurate information in vagrant readme.rst

The vagrant readme.rst indicated using ssh command to login
to the VMs created by vagrant scripts, however the instructions
uses wrong vm names, also the readme.rst format was not exactly
following the rst format. This patch will fix these issues.

Change-Id: Ia16cecb5a6cebf073aeb8e2da7e40e95256f5948
Closes-bug: #1521312

revisions:
[{'number': 12, 'created': '2015-09-29 19:38:50.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/agent/l3/test_router_info.py', 'neutron/agent/linux/ip_lib.py', 'neutron/agent/l3/router_info.py'], 'message': 'Add check if namespace exist while adding routes

Log trace shows not able to open network namespace
while trying to add static routes.

It seems that the static routes are added into the
snat namespace when the snat namespace is not available.

It is better to check for the existence of the namespace
before executing a command on to the namespace.

This patch makes sure that the namespace existence is
checked before trying to configure the routes.

If the namespace does not exist it will raise an
exception message.

Related-Bug: #1499787
Change-Id: I2e52ae0d30da2576d2fe1c459716ff960d276217
'}]
commit_message:
Add check if namespace exist while adding routes

Log trace shows not able to open network namespace
while trying to add static routes.

It seems that the static routes are added into the
snat namespace when the snat namespace is not available.

It is better to check for the existence of the namespace
before executing a command on to the namespace.

This patch makes sure that the namespace existence is
checked before trying to configure the routes.

If the namespace does not exist it will raise an
exception message.

Related-Bug: #1499787
Change-Id: I2e52ae0d30da2576d2fe1c459716ff960d276217

commit_message:
Drop deprecated templates/Makefile/merge.py

This patch drops a bunch of deprecated stuff from
tripleo-heat-templates. Once we remove the Makefile
(which creates overcloud.yaml) we can proceed
in renaming overcloud-without-mergepy.yaml to
overcloud.yaml.

Change-Id: Ic6ab3777d19e207cae29dcbc2e3839815cd80181

Remove Python 2.6

It hasn't been supported or tested for some time, this change
removes it from tox so it doesn't run by default and also removes
it from the package metadata.

subject: Add script so that deployments won't get rerun
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-12-01 12:35:33.000000000', 'files': ['hot/software-config/elements/heat-config/bin/heat-config-rebuild-deployed'], 'message': "Add script so that deployments won't get rerun

This script creates the necessary files under /var/run/heat-config so that the
next time configure.d/55-heat-config is executed via os-refresh-config, no
deployments that were already known are rerun.

This is a workaround for https://bugs.launchpad.net/heat-templates/+bug/1513220
in scenarios where /var/run/heat-config has already been lost due to a scenario
such as a system reboot.

This script is a manual workaround, and should only be executed on instances
where it's known that the deployments do not need to be reapplied.

Change-Id: I3ac4e280a39acb893a8ecc94712eb6265a1236d2
Partial-Bug: #1513220
"}]
commit_message:
Add script so that deployments won't get rerun

This script creates the necessary files under /var/run/heat-config so that the
next time configure.d/55-heat-config is executed via os-refresh-config, no
deployments that were already known are rerun.

This is a workaround for https://bugs.launchpad.net/heat-templates/+bug/1513220
in scenarios where /var/run/heat-config has already been lost due to a scenario
such as a system reboot.

This script is a manual workaround, and should only be executed on instances
where it's known that the deployments do not need to be reapplied.

Change-Id: I3ac4e280a39acb893a8ecc94712eb6265a1236d2
Partial-Bug: #1513220

commit_message:
Add routing and load balancer detail page

This adds the routing to allow navigating between angular pages as
well as the beginning of the load balancer detail page. The detail
page is very basic but is based on both the existing angular Images
detail page and the designs from invision. It includes two empty
tabs that will eventually hold the tables for Pools and Members.

Partially-Implements: blueprint horizon-lbaas-v2-ui
Change-Id: Icbf4396238036b20712ca643e635dd84fe66a86e

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-25 20:15:25.000000000', 'files': ['elements/puppet-stack-config/puppet-stack-config.yaml.template'], 'message': 'Disable the nova ec2 API

This will save us around 120MB of memory which is wasted
on this extra process in the undercloud.

NOTE: We could save more by running nova-api-os-compute and
nova-api-metadata as individual processes instead of using
the nova-api "launcher" (which wastes memory). It may be worth

commit_message:
Disable the nova ec2 API

This will save us around 120MB of memory which is wasted
on this extra process in the undercloud.

NOTE: We could save more by running nova-api-os-compute and
nova-api-metadata as individual processes instead of using
the nova-api "launcher" (which wastes memory). It may be worth
just waiting for Apache mod_wsgi to try this out though.

Change-Id: I2d9ce88850bf821ac3bf8e4dfa35b2a5f2856fa8

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-20 17:21:48.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/test_srb.py'], 'message': 'Refactor SRB Unittest LVM command handlers.

For the LVM command act() handlers, call them with any env variable
settings stripped off the head of the cmd list passed in; this makes
it easier to maintain patches that add or remove env variable values
as the cmd list indexes in the act() handler will not change, and the
check() handler already validates that the env settings are present.
The stripping is performed by the newly added _strip_env_settings()
helper.

Created _lvm_size_to_bytes() helper function to replace a repeated
pattern of code identified in the LVM command act() handlers.

Change-Id: Iea2adf7579c6aa0341521aaa91b99081e4701e2b
'}]
commit_message:
Refactor SRB Unittest LVM command handlers.

For the LVM command act() handlers, call them with any env variable
settings stripped off the head of the cmd list passed in; this makes
it easier to maintain patches that add or remove env variable values
as the cmd list indexes in the act() handler will not change, and the
check() handler already validates that the env settings are present.
The stripping is performed by the newly added _strip_env_settings()
helper.

Created _lvm_size_to_bytes() helper function to replace a repeated
pattern of code identified in the LVM command act() handlers.

Change-Id: Iea2adf7579c6aa0341521aaa91b99081e4701e2b

commit_message:
release keystone managed libraries for mitaka-1

in preparation for mitaka-1 we are releasing new versions of all
keystone managed libraries, this includes: keystoneauth,
keystonemiddleware, keystoneclient and pycadf.

major version bumps were performed since we are dropped py26
support for each one.

Change-Id: I73e301e26ff4cf91c530cce8bde0a68fc215b54c

revisions:

Ironic does not support UEFI with iPXE, so we need an option to use plain PXE.
With this patch we still build an iPXE environment as well, in case a user
will want to switch to it later.

Change-Id: I2bc88005cd98adf1c01a8d5df23af723e1f1fe3a
'}]
commit_message:
Add option to switch between PXE and iPXE for deploy when bulding undercloud

Ironic does not support UEFI with iPXE, so we need an option to use plain PXE.
With this patch we still build an iPXE environment as well, in case a user
will want to switch to it later.

Change-Id: I2bc88005cd98adf1c01a8d5df23af723e1f1fe3a

commit_message:

f1f79b8 Rel notes for 0.10.0
7b9bec7 Updated from global requirements
be3d7a6 Remove useless config.py file
b709dd6 vmware: check for response body in error conditions
6993aac remove default=None for config options
341527c Updated from global requirements
2142bd3 Imported Translations from Zanata
fdd725e Updated from global requirements
aa53ea6 Updated from global requirements
d59254e Remove deprecated glance_store opts from default section
6019576 Updated from global requirements
845254f Improving GlanceStoreException
5db9852 Activate pep8 check that _ is imported

c2b8702 Handle swift store's optional dependency

Because of the dependency updates and deprecated option removal, this is

commit_message:
Release python-cinderclient 1.5.0

There have been several bug fixes to the cinder client
as well as the addition of commands for working with
v2 replication. We would like to get the replication
support out there to help as more vendors implement
support in their backend drivers.

Change-Id: I19e70591f121def9d6559c654f5d0f10b5d2451f

commit_message:
Remove deprecated notification event_type

For role assignment notifications there were two notifications
being emitted. We deprecated the original notification event_type
in Kilo and can now remove it in Mitaka. Also update a reference
of the old event_type in the notification docs.

implements bp removed-as-of-mitaka

Change-Id: I42e68d2b95014fb7500a709de6ecbd8e5f93bac4

commit_message:
Remove db and object usage in cli.commands.verify module

In order to make Rally as a Service, rally CLI modules do not
allow to work with rally.common.db and rally.common.objects.

This patch remove rally.common.db and rally.common.objects
usage in cli.commands.verify moudle, and make necessary change
on unit tests.

Change-Id: Ic4b264c6ffff6d1f2b8b8b609e32ca4d164d18b8

This commit adds a new REST API method to get a time series of
test_runs given the test_id for a test. The intent here is to enable

commit_message:
Add a rest api to get a test_runs time series by test

This commit adds a new REST API method to get a time series of
test_runs given the test_id for a test. The intent here is to enable
a per test view with a graph of success and failures over time, as
well as a test run_time graphed over time.

Change-Id: Id7fe36c3e1ca069d942fe246d688648f719d3168

subject: Don't double-print exception subjects
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-12-01 17:01:35.000000000', 'files': ['shade/_utils.py', 'shade/exc.py'], 'message': "Don't double-print exception subjects

We're creating an error message string that contains the shade message
and the underlying message AND we're passing the underlying message in
so that we append it as part of the Inner Exception string. So we wind
up with something like:

  Error in creating volume: Invalid input received: 'size' parameter
  must be between 75 and 1024 (HTTP 400) (Request-ID:
  req-ae3f3489-997b-4038-8c9f-efbe7dd73a70) (Inner Exception: Invalid
  input received: 'size' parameter must be between 75 and 1024)

Which is a bit insane. With this change, the above becomes:

  Error in creating volume (Inner Exception: Invalid input received:
  'size' parameter must be between 75 and 1024 (HTTP 400) (Request-ID:
  req-d4da66b2-41eb-44c8-85f1-064454af5a1c))

And if the shade_exceptions context manager is invoked with no message,
the output will be:

  Invalid input received: 'size' parameter must be between 75 and 1024
  (HTTP 400) (Request-ID: req-d4da66b2-41eb-44c8-85f1-064454af5a1c))

Change-Id: I6bd70b70585722d2266ef08496b6860aeeab1824
"}]
commit_message:
Don't double-print exception subjects

We're creating an error message string that contains the shade message
and the underlying message AND we're passing the underlying message in
so that we append it as part of the Inner Exception string. So we wind
up with something like:

  Error in creating volume: Invalid input received: 'size' parameter
  must be between 75 and 1024 (HTTP 400) (Request-ID:
  req-ae3f3489-997b-4038-8c9f-efbe7dd73a70) (Inner Exception: Invalid
  input received: 'size' parameter must be between 75 and 1024)

Which is a bit insane. With this change, the above becomes:

  Error in creating volume (Inner Exception: Invalid input received:
  'size' parameter must be between 75 and 1024 (HTTP 400) (Request-ID:
  req-d4da66b2-41eb-44c8-85f1-064454af5a1c))

And if the shade_exceptions context manager is invoked with no message,
the output will be:

  Invalid input received: 'size' parameter must be between 75 and 1024
  (HTTP 400) (Request-ID: req-d4da66b2-41eb-44c8-85f1-064454af5a1c))

Change-Id: I6bd70b70585722d2266ef08496b6860aeeab1824

Add gate test for fuel-agent that should be executed
for each review in openstack/fuel-agent repo.

Next variables should be exported:
UPDATE_FUEL=True
UPDATE_FUEL_PATH=/path/to/source

Test depends on ready,
so it is better to run it with -k option.

Scenario:
    1. Revert snapshot "ready"
    2. Update fuel-agent in MCollective
    3. Update bootstrap
    4. Bootstrap 1 slave
    5. Create environment via FUEL CLI
    6. Assign controller role
    7. Provisioning node

Change-Id: I323398d5a039896f3ec8793ba64b6a6541a4967f
Closes-Bug: #1519880
'}]
commit_message:
Add gate test for fuel-agent repo

Add gate test for fuel-agent that should be executed
for each review in openstack/fuel-agent repo.

Next variables should be exported:
UPDATE_FUEL=True
UPDATE_FUEL_PATH=/path/to/source

Test depends on ready,
so it is better to run it with -k option.

Scenario:
    1. Revert snapshot "ready"
    2. Update fuel-agent in MCollective
    3. Update bootstrap
    4. Bootstrap 1 slave
    5. Create environment via FUEL CLI
    6. Assign controller role
    7. Provisioning node

Change-Id: I323398d5a039896f3ec8793ba64b6a6541a4967f
Closes-Bug: #1519880

commit_message:
Fix pylint breakage for juno branch

pylint depends on the astroid package, which has updated to v1.4.1
and that is incompatible with pylint 1.4.4. To prevent breakage,
we are pinning astroid to 1.3.8 on kilo branch (and pinning pylint
to 1.4.4).

It is expected that pylint will not be updated on this branch.

Change-Id: Ie5df49f5378360976d965df4742a099e83b13008
Depends-On: Iaf2c5dbb92cacbc236083f8f6926a426bfb28f21

subject: Fix unexpected output of pools()
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2015-12-01 18:24:33.000000000', 'files': ['zaqarclient/queues/v1/pool.py'], 'message': 'Fix unexpected output of pools()

As of now, pools() of v1/client.py return
list of pools whose all attributes(like uri, weight etc)
set to None (unexpectedly).

This patch fixes the issue, now all attributes of pool
should be set to their respective values instead of None.

Change-Id: I083fa853cb3712a7fc161521663a5b7ec520254f
Closes-Bug: #1519614
'}]
commit_message:
Fix unexpected output of pools()

As of now, pools() of v1/client.py return
list of pools whose all attributes(like uri, weight etc)
set to None (unexpectedly).

This patch fixes the issue, now all attributes of pool
should be set to their respective values instead of None.

Change-Id: I083fa853cb3712a7fc161521663a5b7ec520254f
Closes-Bug: #1519614

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-24 10:19:12.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py'], 'message': 'libvirt: catch libvirtError when init_host

There might be some wrong setting of compute and leads to
exception of libvirt during init_host, this will make the
whole compute service fail to start and nothing can be
done on the host. Need to catch the exception and ignore it
to make compute service start.

Change-Id: Ib9444752ee837ec52194b343516f4bd0bb8653fb
Closes-Bug: 1447342
'}]
commit_message:
libvirt: catch libvirtError when init_host

There might be some wrong setting of compute and leads to
exception of libvirt during init_host, this will make the
whole compute service fail to start and nothing can be
done on the host. Need to catch the exception and ignore it
to make compute service start.

Change-Id: Ib9444752ee837ec52194b343516f4bd0bb8653fb
Closes-Bug: 1447342

commit_message:
Add ordereddict requirement for py26 tests

Tests which required OrderedDict were failing because Python 2.6 doesn't
have a native OrderedDict implementation.

Change-Id: Id3b0a9126279bf628022dba596d58b9e3ddb2b52
Closes-bug: 1520544

* Create ceilometer::dispatcher::gnocchi class, with current upstream options.
* Add an example of manifest.
* Unit & functional tests.

Note:
This patch implement os_service_defaults only for the new class.

Change-Id: Id9364e1e1337708b1e0254b4c6268f1a0b1a42ad

commit_message:
Implement Gnocchi dispatcher

* Add dispatcher options to ceilometer::collector.
* Create ceilometer::dispatcher::gnocchi class, with current upstream options.
* Add an example of manifest.
* Unit & functional tests.

Note:
This patch implement os_service_defaults only for the new class.
For collector, it will be updated in one patch in another patchset.

Change-Id: Id9364e1e1337708b1e0254b4c6268f1a0b1a42ad

commit_message:
Ensure to_dict() supports non-ascii characters

When we compose a string for user_identity, we should
ensure that we don't break for non-ascii strings in
user name or tenant name or domain names.

Closes-Bug: #1507937
Change-Id: I485c2a36dd3e12fd2daeda176791909e07cf9c4c

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4328, 'name': 'Steven Hardy', 'email': 'steven.hardy@suse.com', 'username': 'shardy'}, {'_account_id': 6618, 'name': 'Ruby Loo', 'email': 'opensrloo@gmail.com', 'username': 'rloo'}, {'_account_id': 6637, 'name': 'Sam Betts', 'email': 'sam@code-smash.net', 'username': 'sambetts'}, {'_account_id': 6773, 'name': 'Lucas Alvares Gomes', 'email': 'lucasagomes@gmail.com', 'username': 'lucasagomes'}, {'_account_id': 10239, 'name': 'Dmitry Tantsur', 'email': 'dtantsur@protonmail.com', 'username': 'dtantsur'}, {'_account_id': 14629, 'name': 'HPE Proliant', 'email': 'proliantutils@gmail.com', 'username': 'proliantci'}, {'_account_id': 16986, 'name': 'Shuquan Huang', 'email': 'huang.shuquan@99cloud.net', 'username': 'shuquan'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2015-12-01 10:16:20.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/boot-ipxe-inc-workaround-548e10d1d6616752.yaml', 'ironic/drivers/modules/boot.ipxe'], 'message': "Fall back to old boot.ipxe behaviour if inc command is not found

We introduced looping over all NIC's as on older iPXE ROM's ${mac} variable
does not always point to the PXE-booting NIC. However, CentOS/RHEL ship
even older iPXE ROM that does not even have inc command at all.

This patch restores the old behaviour of relying on ${mac} variable when
inc command cannot be executed. It's still not perfect and might break
sometimes, but it won't be completely broken. Nothing is changes for users
for which inc command is already working.

Change-Id: I30b8c0e4ab076684ea9baa042e5a9a4f44da9a3a
Closes-Bug: #1507738
"}]
commit_message:
Fall back to old boot.ipxe behaviour if inc command is not found

We introduced looping over all NIC's as on older iPXE ROM's ${mac} variable
does not always point to the PXE-booting NIC. However, CentOS/RHEL ship
even older iPXE ROM that does not even have inc command at all.

This patch restores the old behaviour of relying on ${mac} variable when
inc command cannot be executed. It's still not perfect and might break
sometimes, but it won't be completely broken. Nothing is changes for users
for which inc command is already working.

Change-Id: I30b8c0e4ab076684ea9baa042e5a9a4f44da9a3a
Closes-Bug: #1507738

subject: Cleanup all handlers in _setup_logging_from_conf
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-12-01 11:03:21.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_log/tests/unit/test_log.py', 'oslo_log/log.py'], 'message': "Cleanup all handlers in _setup_logging_from_conf

_setup_logging_from_conf doesn't remove all previously registered
handlers and some of them may get registered twice which can
result in duplicating logs.

Iterating through a collection and removing items from it is bad
practice and should be avoided.

Conflicts:
         oslo_log/tests/unit/test_log.py

Change-Id: I869f12a7ca8f6672a344159474d8b3d4ee584e57
Closes-Bug: #1520235
(cherry picked from commit fcf3115539d191e3ad166b12a08c4c662ebf5c17)
"}]
commit_message:
Cleanup all handlers in _setup_logging_from_conf

_setup_logging_from_conf doesn't remove all previously registered
handlers and some of them may get registered twice which can
result in duplicating logs.

Iterating through a collection and removing items from it is bad
practice and should be avoided.

Conflicts:
         oslo_log/tests/unit/test_log.py

Change-Id: I869f12a7ca8f6672a344159474d8b3d4ee584e57
Closes-Bug: #1520235
(cherry picked from commit fcf3115539d191e3ad166b12a08c4c662ebf5c17)

[{'number': 12, 'created': '2015-11-12 16:40:27.000000000', 'files': ['specs/mitaka/api-microversions.rst'], 'message': "cinder-api-microversions

Many changes to the Cinder REST API require changes to the consumers of the API.
For example, If we need to add a required parameter to a method that is called
by Nova, we'd need both the Nova calling code and the cinderclient that
Nova uses to change. But newer Cinder versions with the change must work with
older Nova versions, and there is no mechanism for this at the moment. Adding
microversions will solve this problem.

With microversions, the highest supported version will be negotiated by a field
in the HTTP header that is sent to the Cinder API. In the case where the field
'versions' is not sent (i.e. clients and scripts that pre-date this change),
then the lowest supported version would be used. This means that our current
Cinder API v2 would be the default, and consumers of the API that wished to
use a newer version could do so.

Implements: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/cinder/+spec/cinder-api-microversions
Change-Id: I2eb6b3aa86f8f6224dd223a8b8cef34ea15ce1e2
"}]
commit_message:
cinder-api-microversions

Many changes to the Cinder REST API require changes to the consumers of the API.
For example, If we need to add a required parameter to a method that is called
by Nova, we'd need both the Nova calling code and the cinderclient that
Nova uses to change. But newer Cinder versions with the change must work with
older Nova versions, and there is no mechanism for this at the moment. Adding
microversions will solve this problem.

With microversions, the highest supported version will be negotiated by a field
in the HTTP header that is sent to the Cinder API. In the case where the field
'versions' is not sent (i.e. clients and scripts that pre-date this change),
then the lowest supported version would be used. This means that our current
Cinder API v2 would be the default, and consumers of the API that wished to
use a newer version could do so.

Implements: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/cinder/+spec/cinder-api-microversions
Change-Id: I2eb6b3aa86f8f6224dd223a8b8cef34ea15ce1e2

Internally delorean does "git reset --hard origin/<branch>" so we

Change-Id: I2f69207465a953c259d539e557072ef9d5164752
'}]
commit_message:
Set origin/stable/liberty to the REF we want to build

Internally delorean does "git reset --hard origin/<branch>" so we
need to set this so it stays as the ZUUL set revision. We were
already doing this for master.

In the long term we should extent delorean to accept git references
to be built.

Change-Id: I2f69207465a953c259d539e557072ef9d5164752

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-26 02:47:33.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/api/admin/test_shared_network_extension.py', 'neutron/db/common_db_mixin.py'], 'message': 'Add UnionModel support to filter query generator

The _apply_filters_to_query method did not handle UnionModels
so objects leveraging it (i.e. RBAC policies) did not have
queries applied to them.

This patch corrects it by iterating through the component models
of the UnionModel and applying the filters to each component model.
It also adds an API test on RBAC that exercises the filtering.

Change-Id: I449acf359dd61189bbdacd200d7c41a4a88d3de8
Closes-Bug: #1517818
(cherry-picked from 35beca53277d187af0ade05466e81699c6575b07)
'}]
commit_message:
Add UnionModel support to filter query generator

The _apply_filters_to_query method did not handle UnionModels
so objects leveraging it (i.e. RBAC policies) did not have
queries applied to them.

This patch corrects it by iterating through the component models
of the UnionModel and applying the filters to each component model.
It also adds an API test on RBAC that exercises the filtering.

Change-Id: I449acf359dd61189bbdacd200d7c41a4a88d3de8
Closes-Bug: #1517818
(cherry-picked from 35beca53277d187af0ade05466e81699c6575b07)

The use of <base> prevented the clip-path from working as intended,
causing rects in the timeline to overflow onto the worker labels.
This patch removes the <base> tag and disables HTML5 links (which

Change-Id: Ia36abfc4f7f2a0d755c16f9d3c825e33a1c9269a

commit_message:
Fix the timeline clipping path.

The use of <base> prevented the clip-path from working as intended,
causing rects in the timeline to overflow onto the worker labels.
This patch removes the <base> tag and disables HTML5 links (which
would have been needed anyway) to fix the issue.

Change-Id: Ia36abfc4f7f2a0d755c16f9d3c825e33a1c9269a

subject: Revert "Add 'mutable' param to Opt"

This reverts commit d9e3ea699afa65ee5175ccda2420a18830b5b349.

The original commit provided a mutation_hook. DHellmann tells me we
agreed not to provide hooks in oslo.config and rather than remove just

commit_message:
Revert "Add 'mutable' param to Opt"

This reverts commit d9e3ea699afa65ee5175ccda2420a18830b5b349.

The original commit provided a mutation_hook. DHellmann tells me we
agreed not to provide hooks in oslo.config and rather than remove just
the hook, he asked (on https://review.openstack.org/#/c/251471/1) that
I instead revert the whole patch.

A version without the hook is provided as a dependent patch
(https://review.openstack.org/#/c/251471).

Change-Id: I200269b9f14a50d1ec92a3a46b65282b8e89ca6f

revisions:
[{'number': 14, 'created': '2015-11-18 09:31:20.000000000', 'files': ['specs/mitaka/approved/pause-vm-during-live-migration.rst'], 'message': 'Pause VM during live migration

In current implementation there is no way to interact with live
migration through nova. Once started operator/user needs to wait
until it finishes. This spec proposes new action for operators
to pause a VM during transition to destination host.

New action will be different from existing pause operation. In the
case of a pausing a VM during live migration, the paused VM is
automatically activated when migration to the destination host
completes. Libvirt preserves VM state before live migration
and reverts vm state to preserved one after transition.

APIImpact
blueprint pause-vm-during-live-migration
Change-Id: I733f2f178e6a503918d80524a426c04254f66d35
'}]
commit_message:
Pause VM during live migration

In current implementation there is no way to interact with live
migration through nova. Once started operator/user needs to wait
until it finishes. This spec proposes new action for operators
to pause a VM during transition to destination host.

New action will be different from existing pause operation. In the
case of a pausing a VM during live migration, the paused VM is
automatically activated when migration to the destination host
completes. Libvirt preserves VM state before live migration
and reverts vm state to preserved one after transition.

APIImpact
blueprint pause-vm-during-live-migration
Change-Id: I733f2f178e6a503918d80524a426c04254f66d35

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-13 04:41:31.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_privsep/daemon.py', 'oslo_privsep/tests/test_daemon.py', 'requirements.txt', 'oslo_privsep/priv_context.py', 'oslo_privsep/tests/test_capabilities.py', 'oslo_privsep/tests/testctx.py', 'oslo_privsep/capabilities.py'], 'message': 'Add support for Linux capabilities

This change adds a new `capabilities` kwarg to PrivContext, which
specifies the Linux capabilities to retain on the privileged side of
this context.  This allows the privileged daemon to be run as root but
with restricted permissions, or as not-root but still with some limited
superpowers.

A new `capabilities` config option is added to the context config

commit_message:
Add support for Linux capabilities

This change adds a new `capabilities` kwarg to PrivContext, which
specifies the Linux capabilities to retain on the privileged side of
this context.  This allows the privileged daemon to be run as root but
with restricted permissions, or as not-root but still with some limited
superpowers.

A new `capabilities` config option is added to the context config
section that overrides the default capabilities for that context.  It is
expected that this will rarely be used.

Note that there is intentionally no way to specify "I want all
capabilities".

Change-Id: I61169d1d27609deb04115f4119654fd3d0690357

revisions:

This patch adds the ability for users to share a selected timeline

Change-Id: I228d58e68ee986f621a3763bba1a565300c79023

commit_message:
Allow sharing of selected item by page URL.

This patch adds the ability for users to share a selected timeline
item via the page URL. When an item is selected, the page address
is updated to include the current test name as a parameter. If
this link is shared, the test named in the URL will automatically
be highlighed when the page is loaded.

Change-Id: I228d58e68ee986f621a3763bba1a565300c79023

commit_message:
Create an attic for APIs we don't support

Rather than delete APIs we no longer support, move them to a
directory that is not referenced in the index, so they do not
appear on specs.openstack.org.

commit_message:
Add Tooz locks to support A/A HA spec

This spec proposes an approach to wrap local file locks in c-vol's
manager and drivers with Tooz abstraction layer to have a possiblity
of making them distributed.

Implements: blueprint cinder-volume-active-active-support
Change-Id: I69b2da52c4b39c81fccc162890f98834f56d7ef6

[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-09-07 14:19:32.000000000', 'files': ['specs/backlog/approved/parallel-scheduler.rst'], 'message': 'Parallel Scheduler for cells v2 backlog spec

To help share ideas, adding a backlog spec to document the problems
with the current filter scheduler.

It also documents a number of possible solutions that have been
discussed in recent years, that fit together to fix the issues for
public clouds that currently use cells v1 and are looking at moving to
cells v2 in the M release.

Please note: there is currently no blueprint associated with this
specification, as its still in the problem definition and idea gathering
phase.

Change-Id: Ie52b862ace7801c17e3844d5c9ed8cb25a0592f1
'}]
commit_message:
Parallel Scheduler for cells v2 backlog spec

To help share ideas, adding a backlog spec to document the problems
with the current filter scheduler.

It also documents a number of possible solutions that have been
discussed in recent years, that fit together to fix the issues for
public clouds that currently use cells v1 and are looking at moving to
cells v2 in the M release.

Please note: there is currently no blueprint associated with this
specification, as its still in the problem definition and idea gathering
phase.

Change-Id: Ie52b862ace7801c17e3844d5c9ed8cb25a0592f1

subject: Normalize volume objects
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-11-30 22:01:48.000000000', 'files': ['shade/tests/unit/test_caching.py', 'shade/tests/unit/test_meta.py', 'shade/_utils.py', 'shade/tests/fakes.py', 'shade/tests/unit/test_create_volume_snapshot.py', 'shade/openstackcloud.py'], 'message': 'Normalize volume objects

Cinder v1 uses "display_name" and "display_description". Cinder v2
users "name" and "description". Normalize the volume objects so that
both values work as both input and output. Having done this, the
name_key param to _filter_list is no longer needed, since it was there
to work around cinder wanting display name. In the future, if we have
another such thing (like heat) we should likely just normalize the dict
to include a name param rather than making _filter_list carry the
weight - since humans will want to get the name of the objects they work
with.

Co-Authored-By: David Shrewsbury <shrewsbury.dave@gmail.com>

Change-Id: Ia43815fd3d25ff7308e91489645bd3c459072359
'}]
commit_message:
Normalize volume objects

Cinder v1 uses "display_name" and "display_description". Cinder v2
users "name" and "description". Normalize the volume objects so that
both values work as both input and output. Having done this, the
name_key param to _filter_list is no longer needed, since it was there
to work around cinder wanting display name. In the future, if we have
another such thing (like heat) we should likely just normalize the dict
to include a name param rather than making _filter_list carry the
weight - since humans will want to get the name of the objects they work
with.

Co-Authored-By: David Shrewsbury <shrewsbury.dave@gmail.com>

Change-Id: Ia43815fd3d25ff7308e91489645bd3c459072359

commit_message:
New plugin data is collected in statsender

White list for plugins info added into statsender.
Now we are checking that all plugin data is collected in tests. In
case of adding new property to Plugin DB model test checks that
this field is collected by statsender.

Closes-Bug: #1521596

revisions:

This commit enables that subunit-trace shows colored output. Because
there are some people who like colored output. While this doesn't work
for the OpenStack gate for local testing it would be nice to appease
those folks and have a --color flag that adds different colors on the
console output from subunit-trace.

Change-Id: Iac48591786d10c908d63e6df94b979ded7d8dbe1
Closes-Bug: #1519044

commit_message:
Add colored output feature to subunit-trace

This commit enables that subunit-trace shows colored output. Because
there are some people who like colored output. While this doesn't work
for the OpenStack gate for local testing it would be nice to appease
those folks and have a --color flag that adds different colors on the
console output from subunit-trace.

Change-Id: Iac48591786d10c908d63e6df94b979ded7d8dbe1
Closes-Bug: #1519044

commit_message:
Fix timestamp bug on create metrics

Try use rounded timestamp instead
Check if the time returned by list measurements is equals to
the time in metrics itself or plus minus one microsecond
on the time in metrics
Please see JAH-2328 "Milliseconds off by 1 in influx" for
more details

Change-Id: I5eec8b947499bc439cab68ba511a3b40205530f5

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-25 17:11:34.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/emc/scaleio.py'], 'message': "Fix ScaleIO driver provisioning key

In the ScaleIO Cinder volume driver, the parameter 'sio:provisioning'
is wrong. It should be 'sio:provisioning_type' instead. As a result of
this error, the volume is always provisioned as 'thick' even if user
wants to provision a 'thin' volume.

This patch corrects this parameter.

Closes-Bug: #1519611
Change-Id: I7c3b0256af3c30c2f375c0f9373646d3f58cd0d0
(cherry picked from commit 8a428cd73c82f455bcb387637c6163797a532f9d)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix ScaleIO driver provisioning key

In the ScaleIO Cinder volume driver, the parameter 'sio:provisioning'
is wrong. It should be 'sio:provisioning_type' instead. As a result of
this error, the volume is always provisioned as 'thick' even if user
wants to provision a 'thin' volume.

This patch corrects this parameter.

Closes-Bug: #1519611
Change-Id: I7c3b0256af3c30c2f375c0f9373646d3f58cd0d0
(cherry picked from commit 8a428cd73c82f455bcb387637c6163797a532f9d)

subject: [Verify] Fixing issue with failures of Heat tests
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-11-30 21:16:26.000000000', 'files': ['rally/verification/tempest/config.py', 'rally/verification/tempest/config.ini', 'tests/unit/verification/test_config.py'], 'message': '[Verify] Fixing issue with failures of Heat tests

If you take a look at one of latest full runs of Tempest tests, you will
see that about 15 Heat tests fail. It is because of misconfigured option
"instance_type" in the orchestration section and incorrect values of
"max_template_size" and "max_resources_per_stack" options in config.ini.
These options should have the same values like these ones have in the
heat-api.conf file. So it will be better to leave the default values for
them that are suitable for many deployments.

So now "instance_type" option is configured, and "max_template_size" and
"max_resources_per_stack" options were removed.

Change-Id: I0f46e9b365cfd59905986ceb0229e85984548b5e
'}]
commit_message:
[Verify] Fixing issue with failures of Heat tests

If you take a look at one of latest full runs of Tempest tests, you will
see that about 15 Heat tests fail. It is because of misconfigured option
"instance_type" in the orchestration section and incorrect values of
"max_template_size" and "max_resources_per_stack" options in config.ini.
These options should have the same values like these ones have in the
heat-api.conf file. So it will be better to leave the default values for
them that are suitable for many deployments.

So now "instance_type" option is configured, and "max_template_size" and
"max_resources_per_stack" options were removed.

Change-Id: I0f46e9b365cfd59905986ceb0229e85984548b5e

Sahara content from Horizon

This plugin moves the current content from the horizon repo to this
plugin repo. The code has been tested in a devstack install using the
following steps:

    1. packaging the plugin: "python setup.cfg sdist"
    2. pip installing the tar.gz in the resulting dist directory
    3.  a. (temporary step) remove existing sahara enabled files from
            horizon
            "rm openstack_dashboard/enabled/_18*.py"
        b. finding the install location and changing to it
            "cp sahara_dashboard/enabled/* /opt/stack/horizon/local/enabled"
    4. in /opt/stack/horizon
        a. python manage.py collectstatic
        b. python manage.py compress
    5. restarting the horizon server

Additionally, you can run the unit tests by:
    ./run_tests.sh

    Note: added script to programmatically remove the old configuration
    files from the targeted horizon install, either in venv or system
    install.

Known issues:
  1. running tests locally emits missing neutron service messages.
  2. plugin code for devstack needs to be added
  3. README is inadequate
  4. integration tests are still in horizon repo
  5. local copy of run_tests is heavy weight, but a better solution is
     not available currently.
  6. localization tooling and strings

Change-Id: Icdce2d3e945e612d368556dd5cea1930194c7b67
'}]
commit_message:
Excising Sahara content from Horizon

This plugin moves the current content from the horizon repo to this
plugin repo. The code has been tested in a devstack install using the
following steps:

    1. packaging the plugin: "python setup.cfg sdist"
    2. pip installing the tar.gz in the resulting dist directory
    3.  a. (temporary step) remove existing sahara enabled files from
            horizon
            "rm openstack_dashboard/enabled/_18*.py"
        b. finding the install location and changing to it
            "cp sahara_dashboard/enabled/* /opt/stack/horizon/local/enabled"
    4. in /opt/stack/horizon
        a. python manage.py collectstatic
        b. python manage.py compress
    5. restarting the horizon server

Additionally, you can run the unit tests by:
    ./run_tests.sh

    Note: added script to programmatically remove the old configuration
    files from the targeted horizon install, either in venv or system
    install.

Known issues:
  1. running tests locally emits missing neutron service messages.
  2. plugin code for devstack needs to be added
  3. README is inadequate
  4. integration tests are still in horizon repo
  5. local copy of run_tests is heavy weight, but a better solution is
     not available currently.
  6. localization tooling and strings

Change-Id: Icdce2d3e945e612d368556dd5cea1930194c7b67

created a configuration for logging.

commit_message:
Add extra kernel options to pxe template

In bifrost, we have a setting to add extra kernel options
to pxe template. In order to consume ironic template, we need
this setting to be present on the matching template.

Change-Id: Ibcf7442b749606633cc03ebd2921586c64f218bd

Current Magnum uses method CONF.set_override to change config option's
value with designated value in unit test, but never check if the
designated vaule is valid. Each config option has a type like strOpt,
BoolOpt, etc. StrOpt with parameter choices only allows values in set
of choices. In short word, each config option has limitation for type
and value. In production code, oslo.conf can ensure user's input is
valid, but in unit test, test methods can pass if we use method
CONF.set_override without parameter enforce_type=True even we pass wrong
type or wrong value to config option. This commit makes sure calling
method CONF.set_override with enforce_type=True,
Note: We can't set enforce_type=True by default in oslo.config now, it
may break all project's unit test. We can switch enforce_type=True by
default when all project fix violations like this commit.

Change-Id: I80d91bbc86521bc53272c0ac04100b671fe1d101
Related-Bug: #1517839
"}]
commit_message:
test: make enforce_type=True in CONF.set_override

Current Magnum uses method CONF.set_override to change config option's
value with designated value in unit test, but never check if the
designated vaule is valid. Each config option has a type like strOpt,
BoolOpt, etc. StrOpt with parameter choices only allows values in set
of choices. In short word, each config option has limitation for type
and value. In production code, oslo.conf can ensure user's input is
valid, but in unit test, test methods can pass if we use method
CONF.set_override without parameter enforce_type=True even we pass wrong
type or wrong value to config option. This commit makes sure calling
method CONF.set_override with enforce_type=True,
Note: We can't set enforce_type=True by default in oslo.config now, it
may break all project's unit test. We can switch enforce_type=True by
default when all project fix violations like this commit.

Change-Id: I80d91bbc86521bc53272c0ac04100b671fe1d101
Related-Bug: #1517839

commit_message:
catch more errors in external commands

If the program to run doesn't exist, check_call() throws an OSError
instead of a subprocess.CalledProcessError.

Change-Id: I064f0bb91aa36b689bcfacb6d2818cac27d7e56d

commit_message:
Only mention IPA in the quick start and user guides for DevStack

The old ramdisk is deprecated, so we should not really default to it.
Also this guide makes an assumption that agent_* and pxe_* drivers
can't be used together, which is no longer the case, as IPA handles both.

Consolidate the example local.conf into one enabling both pxe_* and agent_*
drivers with IPA and create a separate page for explaining difference between
these two.

Co-Authored-By: Lilia Sampaio <liliars@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>
Change-Id: Ifeed7bf9128281b79d425f7c5dbb3d8c39e7fb68

subject: Add better names validator and deprecate older one
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-11-05 05:29:04.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/validators.rst', 'anchor/X509/signing_request.py', 'tests/validators/test_callable_validators.py', 'anchor/validators/custom.py', 'anchor/validators/utils.py', 'anchor/X509/extension.py', 'setup.cfg', 'tests/validators/test_base_validation_functions.py'], 'message': 'Add better names validator and deprecate older one

Previous name validators have multiple issues. They do not prevent
unknown entires from passing through. They require repeating rules for
various name locations (cn, san). They also disregard wildcards when
matching only the suffix. The inflexible configuration also makes
specific validators like server_group required.

The new validator whitelist_names solves all those issues and allows to
deprecate old validators.

Implements: blueprint validator-improvement

Change-Id: Id31889f735eb34323f21a91d68a50602351f6611
'}]
commit_message:
Add better names validator and deprecate older one

Previous name validators have multiple issues. They do not prevent
unknown entires from passing through. They require repeating rules for
various name locations (cn, san). They also disregard wildcards when
matching only the suffix. The inflexible configuration also makes
specific validators like server_group required.

The new validator whitelist_names solves all those issues and allows to
deprecate old validators.

Implements: blueprint validator-improvement

Change-Id: Id31889f735eb34323f21a91d68a50602351f6611

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-20 08:32:06.000000000', 'files': ['ironicclient/common/http.py', 'ironicclient/shell.py', 'ironicclient/tests/unit/test_http.py', 'ironicclient/client.py'], 'message': "Implement and enable retries on Conflict

The problem was well known for some time. However, after introduction

(cherry picked from commit 28bdd0baebeeb0bc05c12dfe19fcae75e04e9f07)

commit_message:
Implement and enable retries on Conflict

Getting Conflict errors is pretty annoying, especially when writing
automation scripts. Nova and ironic-discoverd already have their
own logic for retrying on such errors.

This patch adds 'max_retries' and 'retry_interval' arguments to
get_client for tuning or disabling retries.

REASON OF BACKPORT
The problem was well known for some time. However, after introduction
of MANAGEABLE vs AVAILABLE states it started to be really visible
in automation leading to issues like
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1212134
Anyone wanting to use newly introduced inspection from scripts
will have to either implement retry or cherry-pick this commit anyway.

Change-Id: Id9720c87ce3846faec61eb40ccf00970ca798ad2
(cherry picked from commit 28bdd0baebeeb0bc05c12dfe19fcae75e04e9f07)

commit_message:
Run gate-neutron-pep8-constraints on global reqs

Run the gate-neutron-pep8-constraints job on changes to
openstack/requirements as the first non-dsvm addition to the
existing series of representative sample jobs which act as canaries
validating updates to the upper-constraints.txt file.

this change also forces the use of a pylint <1.5 (to be revisited later).

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-25 15:58:42.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/emc/scaleio.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/emc/scaleio/test_misc.py'], 'message': "ScaleIO driver: update_migrated_volume

This patch implements the update_migrated_volume function.
Without this change, when the migrate finishes, the original
volume will be deleted but the name on the new volume will not
be changed to the old id even though the Cinder database will
be updated. The volume name is a base64() encoding of the Cinder
volume id so any calls after the migrate fail since the lookup
fails.

Also changed 'SCALEIO' to connector.SCALEIO now that os-brick 0.4.0
is released.

Closes-Bug: #1512387
Change-Id: I70fe4bd651b0ac87b9208efb5918a4cdaf6f06b4
(cherry picked from commit 64437898cdf58d4d028975155bda3d21a014bfe1)
"}]
commit_message:
ScaleIO driver: update_migrated_volume

This patch implements the update_migrated_volume function.
Without this change, when the migrate finishes, the original
volume will be deleted but the name on the new volume will not
be changed to the old id even though the Cinder database will
be updated. The volume name is a base64() encoding of the Cinder
volume id so any calls after the migrate fail since the lookup
fails.

Also changed 'SCALEIO' to connector.SCALEIO now that os-brick 0.4.0
is released.

Closes-Bug: #1512387
Change-Id: I70fe4bd651b0ac87b9208efb5918a4cdaf6f06b4
(cherry picked from commit 64437898cdf58d4d028975155bda3d21a014bfe1)

commit_message:
Allow to install plugin to operational environment

- Added attribute 'is_runtime' to plugin. this attribute means
  that plugin can be installed to operational env.
- Make attribute 'is_locked' public and remove logic to calculate
  the cluster is locked or not from UI.

Change-Id: I372bfb2c502bcd5927533b03aea1557cf49d9afb
Closes-Bug: #1519050

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-01 14:30:23.000000000', 'files': ['networking_calico/plugins/ml2/drivers/calico/election.py', 'networking_calico/plugins/ml2/drivers/calico/t_etcd.py'], 'message': "Reduce election refresh interval, handle EtcdEventIndexCleared.

Reduce refresh interval so event buffer is less likely to wrap
while we're waiting.

If we do hit EtcdEventIndexCleared, suppress spammy warning log

Change-Id: Icc0d64bbaf3d99d824a578f67888e8d81f0e5bae
Closes-Bug: #1521638
"}]
commit_message:
Reduce election refresh interval, handle EtcdEventIndexCleared.

Reduce refresh interval so event buffer is less likely to wrap
while we're waiting.

If we do hit EtcdEventIndexCleared, suppress spammy warning log
since we handle that case.

Change-Id: Icc0d64bbaf3d99d824a578f67888e8d81f0e5bae
Closes-Bug: #1521638

subject: Allow to set resource type for aggregation
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-11-30 13:27:02.000000000', 'files': ['gnocchiclient/v1/metric.py', 'gnocchiclient/v1/metric_cli.py', 'gnocchiclient/tests/functional/test_metric.py'], 'message': "Allow to set resource type for aggregation

On Gnocchi API, for the 'aggregation across metrics' we need to
set the resource_type to be able to create query against extended
attribute of resources, like filter on 'server_group' for a 'instance'.

This change allows that.

Change-Id: I30dc0cac07adcfcf80eab1b77850cd742a9bb6d3
"}]
commit_message:
Allow to set resource type for aggregation

On Gnocchi API, for the 'aggregation across metrics' we need to
set the resource_type to be able to create query against extended
attribute of resources, like filter on 'server_group' for a 'instance'.

This change allows that.

Change-Id: I30dc0cac07adcfcf80eab1b77850cd742a9bb6d3

commit_message:
Fix pep8 issues

Unblock the gate. Did the following:

1. Fixed import order
2. update pylint to exclude:
  too-many-statements,
  redefined-variable-type,
  simplifiable-if-statement,
  not-an-iterabl,
  abstract-class-instantiated,
  too-many-nested-blocks,
  unsubscriptable-object,
  not-an-iterable

Closes-bug: #1521620

Change-Id: I79e070843e3337fd3e480414fda3eb8f03d9daa0

Remove sharps from release notes

Sharp will be treated as start of a comment, so it will remove
useful information from a release note.

subject: Fix deadlock in status reporting.
revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2015-12-01 15:12:47.000000000', 'files': ['networking_calico/plugins/ml2/drivers/calico/test/test_plugin_etcd.py', 'networking_calico/plugins/ml2/drivers/calico/mech_calico.py'], 'message': 'Fix deadlock in status reporting.

Fixes https://github.com/projectcalico/calico/issues/869
caused by deadlock between eventlet and the C-based mysql
driver.

Resolved in the same way as neutron does by taking the
per-process lock.

As a side-effect, addresses an ambiguity between ports
with the same ID on different hosts (which can occur
during a migration or reschedule).

Closes-Bug: #1519799
Change-Id: I8e459d9cd7fb04d7dad24cfd59d8d455fb8eeb4f
'}]
commit_message:
Fix deadlock in status reporting.

Fixes https://github.com/projectcalico/calico/issues/869
caused by deadlock between eventlet and the C-based mysql
driver.

Resolved in the same way as neutron does by taking the
per-process lock.

As a side-effect, addresses an ambiguity between ports
with the same ID on different hosts (which can occur
during a migration or reschedule).

Closes-Bug: #1519799
Change-Id: I8e459d9cd7fb04d7dad24cfd59d8d455fb8eeb4f

commit_message:
Enable Neutron's port security

Port security extension allows turn off L2 filtering on specified Neutron ports
This extension was developed in Kilo cycle and addresses issues raised up
by operators who were not able to pass L2 traffic to OpenStack instances.

Change-Id: Idc2abdcfdfb9e62f7cda3f1429ce45cd75c6929e
Closes-bug: #1514010

commit_message:
Override verify argument of generic session

Added config option to support that. It can be useful to
disable verification of certificate during generic session
creation on some deployments.

Change-Id: I99433684c72e10f5437d83e785e5ad5f049f3767
Closes-bug: 1517918

The patching mostly done for tests for nailgun components adhering to
the release version. E.g. network serializers. Some tests are forced to
create environments of 8.0 version. The change is needed to resolve
possible issues with the tests when network roles metadata is changed
drastically and is not compatible with mentioned components.

Partial-Bug: #1517874
Change-Id: I55607157ae7767ffdfd1d855b872630832706e8e
'}]
commit_message:
Patch network_roles_metadata for 7.0 release where needed

The patching mostly done for tests for nailgun components adhering to
the release version. E.g. network serializers. Some tests are forced to
create environments of 8.0 version. The change is needed to resolve
possible issues with the tests when network roles metadata is changed
drastically and is not compatible with mentioned components.

Partial-Bug: #1517874
Change-Id: I55607157ae7767ffdfd1d855b872630832706e8e

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-10-29 16:03:06.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/nova/manifests/vncproxy.pp'], 'message': 'Set correct vncproxy_protocol parameter in nova::vncproxy

https protocol was introduce in MOS 7.0 and default value for

Closes-bug: #1511422

commit_message:
Set correct vncproxy_protocol parameter in nova::vncproxy

https protocol was introduce in MOS 7.0 and default value for
vncproxy_protocol should be changed from http to https.

Change-Id: I6999579a14a9b20dec4230c2b2efe8aafe7b681c
Closes-bug: #1511422

revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2015-11-27 22:30:21.000000000', 'files': ['run_tests.sh', 'fixtures/scenario001.pp', 'README.md'], 'message': 'scenario001: deploy & test Aodh

Aodh is the new service that replaces Ceilometer Alarm.
This patch aims to:

* deploy Aodh in scenario001 (beside Ceilometer).
* drop ceilometer alarm code (replaced by puppet-aodh).
* add TelemetryAlarming testing (to validate Telemetry Alarm with Aodh).

Change-Id: I1acde0fad6c36429562d8576663c4cb9d393a79d
'}]
commit_message:
scenario001: deploy & test Aodh

Aodh is the new service that replaces Ceilometer Alarm.
This patch aims to:

* deploy Aodh in scenario001 (beside Ceilometer).
* drop ceilometer alarm code (replaced by puppet-aodh).
* add TelemetryAlarming testing (to validate Telemetry Alarm with Aodh).

Change-Id: I1acde0fad6c36429562d8576663c4cb9d393a79d

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-08-05 23:36:48.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_auth/tests/tests.py', 'openstack_auth/plugin/password.py', 'openstack_auth/backend.py'], 'message': 'Use unscoped token for scoping to project

When authenticating a user in v3, always request
for an unscoped token. Otherwise it would automatically
default to the default project.

Change-Id: I9e1d9129e2fb35933c803096fca9f1236affc27f
Closes-Bug: #1474893
(cherry picked from commit e4062e37069d58814b7c09299d3018297a75ba1d)
'}]
commit_message:
Use unscoped token for scoping to project

When authenticating a user in v3, always request
for an unscoped token. Otherwise it would automatically
default to the default project.

Change-Id: I9e1d9129e2fb35933c803096fca9f1236affc27f
Closes-Bug: #1474893
(cherry picked from commit e4062e37069d58814b7c09299d3018297a75ba1d)

subject: Improve release notes guidance - single patch
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-30 18:34:19.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/contributing.rst'], 'message': 'Improve release notes guidance - single patch

After some discussion on a patch and in room with Doug,
we determined that we should make the guidance for release notes
more strongly suggest providing release notes in the same
patch as the changes being introduced.

Change-Id: Ifa8e8e9b01fafaa0a7e3e12b0052e4f8d5554e58
'}]
commit_message:
Improve release notes guidance - single patch

After some discussion on a patch and in room with Doug,
we determined that we should make the guidance for release notes
more strongly suggest providing release notes in the same
patch as the changes being introduced.

Change-Id: Ifa8e8e9b01fafaa0a7e3e12b0052e4f8d5554e58

commit_message:
Simplify ping usage for service VM check in CI

Just rely on the return code from "ping" instead of
parsing it's output when checking the service VM during
the CI run.

Change-Id: I20f144687662a0dda5fdfc0293ab578009658c1b

revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2015-11-20 17:03:03.000000000', 'files': ['elements/dynamic-login/init-scripts/systemd/dynamic-login.service', 'elements/dynamic-login/package-installs.yaml', 'elements/dynamic-login/install.d/70-enable-dynamic-login-services', 'elements/dynamic-login/static/usr/local/bin/dynamic-login', 'elements/dynamic-login/README.rst', 'elements/dynamic-login/element-deps', 'elements/dynamic-login/init-scripts/sysv/dynamic-login.init', 'elements/dynamic-login/init-scripts/upstart/dynamic-login.conf'], 'message': 'Add dynamic-login element

Troubleshooting an image can be quite hard, specially if you can not get
a prompt you can enter commands to find out what went wrong. By default,
the images (specially ramdisks) doesn't have any SSH key or password for
any user. Of course one could use the ``devuser`` element to generate
an image with SSH keys and user/password in the image but that would be
a massive security hole and very it's discouraged to run in production
with a ramdisk like that.

This commit is adding a new element called dynamic-login, which inserts
a helper script into the image to allow operators to inject a SSH key
and/or change the root password dynamically when it boots via parameters
in the kernel command line.

Those parameters are:

sshkey = If the operator append sshkey="$PUBLIC_SSH_KEY" to the kernel
command line on boot, the helper script will append this key to the root
user authorized_keys.

rootpwd = If the operator append rootpwd="$ENCRYPTED_PASSWORD" to the
kernel command line on boot, the helper script will set the root password
to the one specified by this option. Note that this password should be
an encrypted password.

Change-Id: I6b87a1b90163d79745f30dfacd37516051fa0aea
'}]
commit_message:
Add dynamic-login element

Troubleshooting an image can be quite hard, specially if you can not get
a prompt you can enter commands to find out what went wrong. By default,
the images (specially ramdisks) doesn't have any SSH key or password for
any user. Of course one could use the ``devuser`` element to generate
an image with SSH keys and user/password in the image but that would be
a massive security hole and very it's discouraged to run in production
with a ramdisk like that.

This commit is adding a new element called dynamic-login, which inserts
a helper script into the image to allow operators to inject a SSH key
and/or change the root password dynamically when it boots via parameters
in the kernel command line.

Those parameters are:

sshkey = If the operator append sshkey="$PUBLIC_SSH_KEY" to the kernel
command line on boot, the helper script will append this key to the root
user authorized_keys.

rootpwd = If the operator append rootpwd="$ENCRYPTED_PASSWORD" to the
kernel command line on boot, the helper script will set the root password
to the one specified by this option. Note that this password should be
an encrypted password.

Change-Id: I6b87a1b90163d79745f30dfacd37516051fa0aea

commit_message:
Revert "Revert "Separate CentOS from MOS""

Fix the problem with separate repos to support rebuild docker

1. Make a symlink for mos-centos in /var/www/nailgun in iso/ks.template
2. Add mos-repos to the bootstrap_admin_node.sh

This reverts commit 32b136301591277dd87f3d367c1370a8a093fb02.

Closes-bug: #1521551
Change-Id: I8ef58b581f253b26d158b725a9e366d7f1b3706d

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-01 02:58:13.000000000', 'files': ['test-requirements.txt'], 'message': 'Pin astroid package for local testing

pylint depends on the asteroid package, and pylint 1.4.4
when used with astroid 1.4.0 or 1.4.1 is broken. This change
pins astroid at 1.3.8, which is compatible with pylint 1.4.4
and will allow local pep8 runs to pass.

There is no problem on liberty and master branches for gate
runs, because the pep8 constraints job is used and it relies
on the upper constraints file, which pins astroid at 1.3.8
(and global requirements pins pylint at 1.4.4).

Note: If, at a later time, a move is made to pylint 1.5.0 and
astroid 1.4.1, the code will need to be updated as new failures
are detected with that version.

Change-Id: Iae26ba01ddac7c824550a090b72fa162b5cfd5ea
'}]
commit_message:
Pin astroid package for local testing

pylint depends on the asteroid package, and pylint 1.4.4
when used with astroid 1.4.0 or 1.4.1 is broken. This change
pins astroid at 1.3.8, which is compatible with pylint 1.4.4
and will allow local pep8 runs to pass.

There is no problem on liberty and master branches for gate
runs, because the pep8 constraints job is used and it relies
on the upper constraints file, which pins astroid at 1.3.8
(and global requirements pins pylint at 1.4.4).

Note: If, at a later time, a move is made to pylint 1.5.0 and
astroid 1.4.1, the code will need to be updated as new failures
are detected with that version.

Change-Id: Iae26ba01ddac7c824550a090b72fa162b5cfd5ea

commit_message:
Add sanity tests for testing actions with Node

Smoke tests for the Ironic CLI commands
which checks basic actions with node command like
create, update, delete etc.

Add get_table_headers() method that allows to
get table header from cmd output.
Add 'utils' module
Table structure tests have been updated.

Implements: blueprint ironicclient-functional-tests

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-10-08 19:43:04.000000000', 'files': ['rally/verification/tempest/config.ini'], 'message': 'Configure Tempest to use isolated tenants

Rally is running Tempest in parallel but it is not configuring it to
run in parallel correctly. For Tempest to be able to run in parallel
correctly it needs to be set up to use either Tenant Isolation, or
Locking Test Accounts, currently Rally was configuring Tempest to use
Non-Locking Test Accounts which could cause execution problems due to
tempest not being able to isolate tests properly.

Change-Id: Idb224ff3dfd4cca9154baabeffb1a520bbb82754
Closes-Bug: 1493147
'}]
commit_message:
Configure Tempest to use isolated tenants

Rally is running Tempest in parallel but it is not configuring it to
run in parallel correctly. For Tempest to be able to run in parallel
correctly it needs to be set up to use either Tenant Isolation, or
Locking Test Accounts, currently Rally was configuring Tempest to use
Non-Locking Test Accounts which could cause execution problems due to
tempest not being able to isolate tests properly.

Change-Id: Idb224ff3dfd4cca9154baabeffb1a520bbb82754
Closes-Bug: 1493147

commit_message:
Support oslo_* namespaces (tests)

Updated oslo components uses oslo_* namespaces instead of oslo.*

It is required to support new ones because CentOS7 master node
also contains updated OpenStack components.

This commit adds support for those.

Blueprint: master-on-centos7

Compatible with CentOS6 master node

Change-Id: I6216961d8bccad75e32778bfaa51bc07a30c7f7c

 git commit --amend

Change-Id: I090105d870dd0c4c207a0e2a7c5acafc49725b05
"}]
commit_message:
Add backlog for release notes during mitaka

This patch adds some release notes items we haven't been documenting so
far. In future, release note items are supposed to be proposed along
with a bug-fix or feature patch when appropriate. To do that, you will
need to first 'pip install reno' as preparation then:

 reno new <release-note-item>
 vi releasenotes/notes/<release-note-item>-<uid>.yaml
 git add releasenotes/notes/<release-note-item>-<uid>.yaml
 git commit --amend

Change-Id: I090105d870dd0c4c207a0e2a7c5acafc49725b05

subject: Provide dhcp-range even for static inventory
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 5805, 'name': 'Chris Krelle', 'email': 'nobodycam@gmail.com', 'username': 'nobodycam'}, {'_account_id': 8106, 'name': 'Haomeng,Wang', 'email': 'wanghaomeng@gmail.com', 'username': 'whaom'}, {'_account_id': 11655, 'name': 'Julia Kreger', 'email': 'juliaashleykreger@gmail.com', 'username': 'jkreger', 'status': 'Flying to the moon with a Jetpack!'}, {'_account_id': 12459, 'name': 'Stephanie Miller', 'email': 'stephane@alum.mit.edu', 'username': 'cinerama'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-11-30 19:37:20.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/roles/bifrost-ironic-install/templates/dnsmasq.conf.j2'], 'message': "Provide dhcp-range even for static inventory

The dnsmasq man page says, regarding the dhcp-host option:

  Addresses allocated like this are not constrained to be in the range
  given by the --dhcp-range option, but they must be in the same subnet
  as some valid dhcp-range.

This confusingly-worded datum means that even when dhcp-host is
defined, which we do when setting inventory_dhcp=true, we need to
specify some kind of dhcp-range. There are a few valid arguments we
could supply to the dhcp-range parameter, but the easiest is just to go
back to using the existing dhcp_pool_{start,end} parameters, from which
dnsmasq will infer a subnet.

An alternative to this is to be more strict by using the 'static'
keyword for dhcp-range. We would still need to specify the
dhcp_pool_start value, which is a required argument for dhcp-range.

Change-Id: I4d09c3a716b864c0b0d74cc83a2f0ac7414b386c
"}]
commit_message:
Provide dhcp-range even for static inventory

The dnsmasq man page says, regarding the dhcp-host option:

  Addresses allocated like this are not constrained to be in the range
  given by the --dhcp-range option, but they must be in the same subnet
  as some valid dhcp-range.

This confusingly-worded datum means that even when dhcp-host is
defined, which we do when setting inventory_dhcp=true, we need to
specify some kind of dhcp-range. There are a few valid arguments we
could supply to the dhcp-range parameter, but the easiest is just to go
back to using the existing dhcp_pool_{start,end} parameters, from which
dnsmasq will infer a subnet.

An alternative to this is to be more strict by using the 'static'
keyword for dhcp-range. We would still need to specify the
dhcp_pool_start value, which is a required argument for dhcp-range.

Change-Id: I4d09c3a716b864c0b0d74cc83a2f0ac7414b386c

subject: tests: increase MySQL max connections
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-11-30 12:27:19.000000000', 'files': ['setup-mysql-tests.sh'], 'message': "tests: increase MySQL max connections

Depending on the number of tests running in parallel, the number of
MySQL connection used can go pretty high since it's used both by the
index and by tooz.

Let's bump this limit since on the gate we have 8 CPU and therefore up
to 8 process running tests with each several threads trying to lock
various metric for upgrade or writing.

Change-Id: I7d6d5dba3975d8359bc1b28f4804d642361687de
"}]
commit_message:
tests: increase MySQL max connections

Depending on the number of tests running in parallel, the number of
MySQL connection used can go pretty high since it's used both by the
index and by tooz.

Let's bump this limit since on the gate we have 8 CPU and therefore up
to 8 process running tests with each several threads trying to lock
various metric for upgrade or writing.

Change-Id: I7d6d5dba3975d8359bc1b28f4804d642361687de

commit_message:
Add flag for test_incremental_backup

Forced creation of incremental backup is not
implemented in old release (Juno and Kilo).
The test is skipped by default for Juno and Kilo gates.
Need to add flag to unskip this test in new release.

New test: Idde2c14aba78382b1063ce20269f4832f9fdd583
Change-Id: I565b5941d6067644fc9ca6cb0891d97f4946e031
Partial-Bug: #1506394

commit_message:
Store settings of Fuel UI Nodes page in DB

"settings" attribute of "master_node_settings" DB model
extended with "ui_settings" property to store
node list configuration from Nodes page in Fuel UI

Related to blueprint view-all-nodes

Co-Authored-By: Alexander Kislitsky <akislitsky@mirantis.com>

Change-Id: I4900c88a02877c4d621e8e835c9aa97097c01fb4

commit_message:
Using 'ready_statuses' instead of 'is_ready'

We are replacing wait_for by wait_for_status now. Changes in this patch
could be apply first, because those changes don't need changes in
wait_for_status function now.

Change-Id: I5240b9df9099208bb847255c9e3ce956f9f718d3

subject: Adjust the RabbitMQ kernel net_ticktime parameter
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6926, 'name': 'Bogdan Dobrelya', 'email': 'bdobreli@redhat.com', 'username': 'bogdando'}, {'_account_id': 8971, 'name': 'Fuel CI', 'username': 'fuel-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 11090, 'name': 'Sergii Golovatiuk', 'email': 'sgolovat@redhat.com', 'username': 'holser'}, {'_account_id': 11827, 'name': 'Stanislaw Bogatkin', 'email': 'regs+ubuntu.com@sbog.ru', 'username': 'sbogatkin'}, {'_account_id': 14689, 'name': 'Vitaly Sedelnik', 'email': 'vitaly.sedelnik@canonical.com', 'username': 'vsedelnik'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-01 10:08:25.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/osnailyfacter/modular/rabbitmq/rabbitmq.pp'], 'message': 'Adjust the RabbitMQ kernel net_ticktime parameter

W/o this fix, the situation is possible when some
arbitrary queue masters got stuck due to high
short-time CPU load spikes ending up in the
rabbitmqctl hanged and affected rabbit node erased
and restarted by OCF monitor logic of the related
pacemaker RA.

This is an issue as it seems that Oslo.messaging yet
to be in a good shape to survive this short-time
outage of underlying AMQP layer without disrupting
interrupted RPC calls being executed.

The workaround is to reduce the net_ticktime kernel
parameter from default 60 seconds to 10 seconds.
What would allow the RabbitMQ cluster to better detect
short-time partitions and autoheal them. And when the
partition has been detected and healed, the rabbitmqctl
would not hang hopefully as stucked queue masters will
be recovered.

Partial-bug: #1460762

Change-Id: I3aa47b51ae080bb4a8b298c61a629ac8225d2abd
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>
(cherry picked from commit 3ffae36b9de967747a1cc1045eae0923d6bd893c)
'}]
commit_message:
Adjust the RabbitMQ kernel net_ticktime parameter

W/o this fix, the situation is possible when some
arbitrary queue masters got stuck due to high
short-time CPU load spikes ending up in the
rabbitmqctl hanged and affected rabbit node erased
and restarted by OCF monitor logic of the related
pacemaker RA.

This is an issue as it seems that Oslo.messaging yet
to be in a good shape to survive this short-time
outage of underlying AMQP layer without disrupting
interrupted RPC calls being executed.

The workaround is to reduce the net_ticktime kernel
parameter from default 60 seconds to 10 seconds.
What would allow the RabbitMQ cluster to better detect
short-time partitions and autoheal them. And when the
partition has been detected and healed, the rabbitmqctl
would not hang hopefully as stucked queue masters will
be recovered.

Partial-bug: #1460762

Change-Id: I3aa47b51ae080bb4a8b298c61a629ac8225d2abd
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>
(cherry picked from commit 3ffae36b9de967747a1cc1045eae0923d6bd893c)
